"The game was denounced by Washington state politicians for its similarity to the real-life 1999 World Trade Organization riots and protests in Seattle which caused $3 million in damages. The game features the fictional "American Trade Organization" as the antagonistic establishment."

Source: Wikipedia, "State of Emergency (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

80324.name: TrollsZine (Issue 2 - May 2010)
rpgissuearticle: How to Write a Solo Adventure
Rings of Power and Sorceror's Scrolls
80324.description:
From the Table of Contents

Trolls Talk To by Dan Prentice
The Trollgod's Judgment by Ken St Andre
The Hoargaunt by Eric Olson
The Jarma-Loh by Nicholas Cloister
The Red River Hippo by Martin Layzell
Maertazz by Tom Grimshaw
Vatarios Drathan by Tori Berquist
Unexpected Adventures by Randy Whitley
The Hunt: a mini GM adventure by Salvatore Macri
On Becoming by W. Scott Grant
Dark Rising: a solo by Tom Grimshaw
I know Kung Fu: combat techniques for T&T by Dan Prentice
Flight to New Khazan by Tom K. Loney
Level and Attribute Advancement by Dan Hembree
Delverton: The Inn by Lee Reynoldson
Grumlahk's Cartoons by Jeff Freels
Spelling Mistakes by Tom Grimshaw
Rings of Power and Sorcerers Scrolls by Salvatore Macri
A Computer Generated Dungeon: A Review by W. Scott Grant
How to write a Solo Adventure: Part 1 by Simon Rafe
Aeulungs Tale: Chapter 2 by Tom Grimshaw
Contributors (uncredited)
Troll Links (uncredited)

80325.name: Throne of Darkness
80325.description:
Summary condensed from the game manual:

In the land of Yamato an evil shogun transforms himself into the immortal demon Zanshin. Zanshin unleashed his horde across Yamato to destroy the opposing clans, however he calls back his army before the last daimyō is killed. The daimyō sends his last seven surviving samurai to destroy Zanshin.

The player controls the last of the surviving samurai in this Diablo like adventure in a Fantasy-Japanese setting.

80326.name: Harpoon Classic 97
80326.description:
From the back of the game box:

Sitting in the frigid waters off the Norwegian Sea, you guard the coastline and begin to plan a full-scale naval assault on the enemy. Suddenly, sensors report a hidden submarine 60 degrees port side and a fleet of enemy ships 92 degrees starboard. Knowing that the best defense is a good offense, you decide to attack. And now, armed with an arsenal of over 100 high-powered weapons, you proceed to destroy everything that stands in the way of total sea control.

Based on the original Harpoon, one of the most sophisticated and realistic contemporary war games ever developed, Harpoon Classic 97 offers two games in one: (1) strategic, modern naval warfare with 50 new missions and (2) a gateway to Harpoon On-line with free Internet play via AOL. Containing new displays, new and updated scenarios and a more intuitive approach, Harpoon Classic 97 will continue to test your growing expertise!

Features:


Introductory quick start mode makes Harpoon Classic 97 easy to play and accessible to everyone



Gateway to Harpoon On-line with FREE play included



50 new missions for a total of over 250 scenarios



Control ships, submarines, and aircraft in four theaters of play: Greenland & Iceland/North Atlantic/Indian Ocean & Persian Gulf/Mediterranean



Upgraded artwork



Over 75 new platforms: ships, submarines, and aircraft - even units that aren't yet operational in real life such as Rafael French Fighter, FF Horizon European Frigate, and others



Scenario editor included on CD



Includes on-line manual plus a storyline of Battlesets


ADDITIONAL FEATURES FOR WINDOWS 95:


Redesign of control interface



Upgraded terrain graphics



Customizable colors

80327.name: Mighty Bombjack
80327.description:
Mighty Bomb Jack is a 1986 arcade game that was later released for the Nintendo Entertainment System (NES) in 1987 by Tecmo, and later for the Amiga, Atari ST and Commodore 64. The NES version was released on the Wii Virtual Console on May 7, 2007. It is a sequel to Bomb Jack.

Each level is split into two parts; an action zone and a Royal Palace room. The mechanics and level designs of the Royal Palace rooms are directly lifted from Bomb Jack. Action zones can be split up into several portions, and contain power-ups usually hidden in treasure chests such as money bags, Mighty Coins and Mighty Drinks. Mighty Coins allow Jack to change colors; blue allows Jack to open orange treasure chests, orange allows him to open any treasure chest by simply touching it from the side, and green transforms all enemies on the screen into coins for 5 seconds. Mighty Drinks add 10 seconds to the game's timer. Secret passages can also be found in the action zones, activated by finding a Sphinx in a visible or hidden treasure chest.

To prevent the player from becoming too "greedy", the game automatically sends the player to a Torture Room if they obtain more than 9 Mighty Coins or 99 seconds on the game's timer. The only way to escape a Torture Room without losing a life is to complete a number of jumps, which are counted down on the screen. Once the player exits the torture room, Jack automatically loses all Mighty Coins, the timer is reset to 60 seconds, and the game recommences from the beginning of the current level.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mighty Bombjack", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

80328.name: Big Bang Mini
80328.description:
From the game box:

Blast your way through this fast-paced shoot 'em up that delivers a new spin on classic arcade game-play! Unleash high-powered fireworks with a flick of your wrist and devastate hordes of amazing enemies across nine fantastic worlds

80329.name: The Dark Spire
80329.description:
From the game box:

A Truly Classic RPG!

Calling all fans of classic, first-person role playing games! Parties shall be assembled, stats shall be rolled, items, weapons, and armor shall be equipped, and monsters shall be slain. This is exploration and character development in the purest sense.

Let your imagination run wild as you explore the dark corners of the Tower in the nostalgic wireframe design of Classic Mode, or immerse yourself in the vibrant 3-D art of Modern Mode.

80330.name: Hoshigami Remix
80330.description:
From the game box:

In a world bound by prophecy, a hero of legend ascends to sever the chains of fate!

videogame: Forgotten Realms: The Archives – Collection Three
80331.name: Dungeon Hack
videogamecompilation: Forgotten Realms: The Archives – Collection Three
80331.description:
User Summary
Dungeon Hack is a first-person-perspective, pseudo-3D dungeon crawler with a gameplay interface based on SSI's own Eye of the Beholder III. Also like Eye of the Beholder III, the game uses the rules from 2nd edition AD&D, and characters can be created using AD&D's set of classes and races. However, the game itself owes many gameplay elements to Rogue. The player controls a single character (rather than a party of up to six as in the Eye of the Beholder series), permanent death with deletion of associated save games is an option, and the dungeon is randomly generated. The player's purported purpose is to find a magical orb, which invariably involves descending to the deepest level of the dungeon. The true purpose of Dungeon Hack, however, is to provide the player with a replayable dungeon crawl uninterrupted by the complications of a plot.

The game was re-released in a number of compilations, including The Forgotten Realms Archive (1997), The Forgotten Realms Archive (Silver Edition) (1999), Forgotten Realms: The Archives Collection Three (1999), and Gamefest: Forgotten Realms Classics (2001).

80332.name: Total Annihilation: The Core Contingency
80332.description:
User Summary

Includes a new campaign featuring 25 missions (12 per side plus a "bonus" mission), 75 new units, and 53 new multiplayer maps.

80333.name: Total Annihilation: Battle Tactics
80333.description:
User Summary

Battle Tactics added little in terms of new content, with just 4 new units and 6 multiplayer maps, but did include about 100 stand-alone missions (half Core, half Arm), many of which did away with resource management entirely. While the latter displeased many fans of the franchise, these missions did highlight a different facet of the game.

80334.name: Pokémon Black and White
videogamehonor: 2011 Japan Game Awards Game of the Year Winner
2012 Japan Game Awards Japanese Game of the Year Winner
80334.description:
Pokémon Black Version and White Version ("Pocket Monsters: Black & White") comprise the upcoming fifth generation of the core Pokémon series of RPGs. The games are set to be released on September 18, 2010, in Japan.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pokémon Black and White", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

80335.name: Pokémon Ranger
80335.description:
Pokémon Ranger is an action/role-playing video game developed by HAL Laboratory and published by Nintendo for the Nintendo DS video game console. It is set in the Fiore region. The region's name originates from the Italian word for flower. The region itself doesn't appear in the Pokémon anime series, although the female protagonist of Pokémon Ranger, Solana, has made an appearance. The Go-Rock Squad is the resident crime syndicate of this region. Fiore itself doesn't have any native Pokémon, but has many Pokémon from other regions. It also does not have any Pokémon Trainers. All people who live with Pokémon keep them outside of Poké Balls, like pets, as Pokémon are never trained here.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pokémon Ranger", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

80336.name: Pokémon Ranger: Shadows of Almia
80336.description:
Pokémon Ranger: Shadows of Almia is an action/role-playing video game developed by Creatures Inc. for the Nintendo DS video game console. It is the sequel to the Pokémon Ranger video game, also for the DS.

The game takes place in the Almia region. The player begins as a Pokémon ranger-in-training at the Ranger School and quickly graduates to a rookie Ranger and must advance from there. The player may choose their character’s gender, but unlike in the original Pokémon Ranger, this choice does not affect their partner Pokémon.

Much of gameplay is similar to the original game. Players must capture/befriend wild Pokémon to aid them by circling them with their Nintendo DS stylus (known as a Capture Styler in the game).

There is a major change from the original capture method. Instead of having to complete certain number of loops without lifting the stylus, the player must fill up a Pokémon’s Friendship Gauge by drawing loops around the Pokémon, but can lift the stylus to avoid attacks. However, the power in Friendship Gauge will decrease over time if the player stops drawing loops for too long. The amount of power in the gauge filled by each loop increases as the player levels up the styler.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pokémon Ranger: Shadows of Almia", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

80337.name: Pokémon Ranger: Guardian Signs
80337.description:
Pokémon Ranger: Guardian Signs is an action role-playing game video game for the Nintendo DS. It is the sequel of Pokémon Ranger and Pokémon Ranger: Shadows of Almia.

Gameplay revolves around capturing Pokémon with the Capture Styler, which now lets you call out your Pokémon for support and use "Ranger Signs" to call Pokémon to help in captures. Other features include four player cooperative play with unique missions. The game also includes Wi-Fi mission downloads, one of which gives you access to Deoxys, which can be moved to the DS's other Pokémon games. According to the Pokemon website, you can also encounter Entei, Raikou, and Suicune.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pokémon Ranger: Guardian Signs", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

80338.name: Teenage Zombies "Invasion of the Alien Brain Thingys"
80338.description:
From the game box:

World Domination, Hordes of aliens, ray guns, mind control & three teenage zombies!!

- Action packed, comic book style presentation
- Swap between zombies to solve levels
- Special power-ups and unique abilities for each character
- stylus mini-games and unique dual screen gameplay
- the diabolical 'Big Brain Challenge'

80339.name: TrollsZine (Issue 3 - July 2010)
rpgissuearticle: How to write a Solo Adventure, Part 2
80339.description:
From the Table of Contents

Credits and Disclaimers (uncredited)
Trolls Talk by Dan Prentice
Four Jars of Mead, a solo adventure by Ken St Andre
Bludgeons and Flagons, an adventure for Trolls by Justin T. Williams
Things Wondrous and Strange, Items by Randy Whitley
The Tomb of Baron Gharoth, a review by Patrice Geille
Pick of the Walla by Ken St Andre
Foul Fiends, monsters by Tori Bergquist
Granak and Demon Bane, monsters by Andrew Greene
Grumlahk's Cartoons by Jeff Freels
The Mehteh, a monster by Andy James
Spells of Cala by Mike Tremaine
Ritual Magic by Mike Tremaine
The Interdimensional Pawn Shoppe by W. Scott Grant
The Temple of Issoth, a solo by Dan Hembree
Background and Inheritance, an option for starting characters by Dan Prentice
Familiars, a Wizard's best friend! by Justin T. Williams
Delverton Three, what ails thee? by Lee Reynoldson
The Tomb of Agathor, an adventure by Tori Bergquist
How to write a Solo Adventure, Part 2 by Simon Rafe
Aeulungs Tale: Chapter 3 by Tom Grimshaw
Contributors (uncredited)
Troll Links (uncredited)

80341.name: 仮面ライダー １１ライダーゲームバトル
80341.description:
Game title translation:
Masked Rider 11 Riders Game Battle
Game title transcription:
Kamen Raida- Ju-ichi Raida- Ge-mu Batoru

From the publisher:
平成仮面ライダーの世界観を反映した7つのゲームが楽しめるゲームセット。
http://catalog.bandai.co.jp/item/4543112551832000.html

Translation with extra description:
A game set comprised of 7 games that incorporates the worlds depicted in the 11 Masked Rider TV series that have aired since 2000 (each series lasted about 1 year). The games include a roll and move game, a concentration game using the game cards, and a rock-paper-scissors game using the game cards. The roll and move game is the showcase game and allows the players to take on the role of one of the 11 main riders from the TV show and travel to the various Masked Rider parallel worlds.

80344.name: F/A-18 Interceptor
videogamehonor: 1989 Golden Joystick Best Simulation Game of the Year Nominee
2000 D.I.C.E. Simulation Game of the Year Nominee (Computer)
80344.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "F/A-18 Interceptor", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

F/A-18 Interceptor is a combat flight simulator released for the Commodore Amiga in 1988. It is widely known for its use of 3D graphics and arcade-style gameplay.

The player mainly flies the F/A-18 Hornet, but the F-16 Fighting Falcon is also available for aerobatics, free flight and the first mission.

The game is set in the San Francisco Bay Area. Notable landmarks include the Golden Gate Bridge, San Francisco Oakland Bay Bridge and Alcatraz Island. The Electronic Arts headquarters in San Mateo are also depicted.

The player can also take off and land from the following airfields:

San Francisco International Airport
Oakland International Airport
Moffett Field NAS
USS Enterprise, anchored approximately 20 miles offshore.
Finally, when selecting a location to start a free flight, pressing the [0] key starts the player on uninhabited ground far away from the main game area. This is in fact supposed to be Edwards Air Force Base, a location that was not actually implemented in the final game.

80347.name: Lords of the Rising Sun
80347.description:
Lords of the Rising Sun is a 1989 video game by Cinemaware, released for the Amiga among other systems. Like the earlier Defender of the Crown, it was a mix of map-based strategy and arcade-style mini games as the player - one of famous Japanese generals Yoshitsune or Yoritomo - fights to pacify Japan by force. In the short documentary "The Total War Story", Mike Simpson, studio director for the company Creative Assembly said that the company's Total War series of games had been influenced by Lords of the Rising Sun. Computer Gaming World gave the game a positive review, admiring the cinematic qualities of the game as well as the mix of action and strategy elements.

Source: Wikipedia, "Lords of the Rising Sun", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

80349.name: Strike Aces
80349.description:
From the back of the game box:

Prepare for the most exciting flight simulation you've ever experienced and enter the world of 3D as you've never seen it before!

In FIGHTER BOMBER feel the thrill and reality of flying the world's most advanced military hardware and classic jet aircraft of our time. You'll be at the controls of devastatingly powerful machines, each responding just like the real thing. Master up to seven of the featured aircraft and enter the Strategic Air Command's annual bombing competition, where the action takes place in the skies above South Dakota, North Dakota, Wyoming and Montana.

FIGHTER BOMBER creates a whole world within your computer for you to explore.

Fly over rivers, highways, mountains, pastures, farms, cities, lakes - an endless list of places to discover. Using the unique "free spirit" control, view the world from an infinite number of perspectives and zero in on the action.

FIGHTER BOMBER brings you the future of 3D simulation software NOW!

80350.name: Fairytale Fights
80350.description:
User summary:

You play as either Little Red Riding Hood, Snow White, Jack or the Naked Emperor and try to help other fairy tale creatures thoughout the game against evil forces, like the lumber jacks, an evil beaver or the valiant little tailor.

While the game features cute bright graphics the point of the game is to butcher through hordes of fairy tale creatures, killing everything that comes along regardless if it is neutral.

Every kind of weapon from bunnies over rats and axes to guns might be used during the carnage, leaving large pools of blood in which you slide around leaving red streaks all over fairy land.

Four players can play cooperatively or kill each other in an arena fight.

80351.name: Mission Patrol 2
80351.description:
MISSION PATROL 2 PRINT & PLAY UNDERWATER GAME.
Mission Patrol 2 is a game that is played with card tiles that you withdraw and roll dice to determine your fate. Your mission to find and locate your targets and set the detonators in the reefs of Kimono and destroy the flesh eating infested sea creatures. The timer's ticking so hurry and reach for the safety boat and escape to win the game. This game is designed to be played by 1 or 2 players.

80353.name: Warlords: Battlecry III
80353.description:
Warlords Battlecry III is a real-time strategy game developed by Infinite Interactive and published in 2004. It is the third installment in the Warlords Battlecry series and the sequel to Warlords Battlecry II.

While Warlords Battlecry III is primarily a real-time strategy game, it has some elements of role-playing in that players can complete optional quests, as well as create a customized Hero character that can level up from battle to battle and equip unique and powerful items.

The Campaign is a mixture of an overhead strategic map with real-time gameplay. Departing from the system used in Warlords Battlecry II, which consisted of a Risk-style board with territories, Warlords Battlecry III divides the world of Etheria into numerous locations (mostly cities) that players travel between, with various events at each. Almost all of the map locations have missions to play, some of which are not readily visible until other missions have been completed, as well as shops, academies, and/or mercenaries for hire. Once a player enters a mission, the game switches to real-time strategy gameplay reminiscent of games such as Warcraft and Age of Empires. Players use four resources, Gold, Metal, Crystal and Stone, which are used to produce a variety of structures and units. Unlike many other RTS games, resources are present as neutral buildings which can be captured and destroyed (not permanently) and generate resources automatically without player input. Although magic and spells come into play, games are usually decided by the player who has a combination of an overwhelming number of superior units and better micromanaging of his Hero character. The Hero typically becomes extremely powerful by late game and can slay tens of normal units alone.

Warlords Battlecry III is unique in its replay ability due to the diplomacy system and the number of races in the game. Depending on which missions have been completed and what was their original race selection, players can be Enemies, Neutral, Friendly, or Allied (which makes that race playable) with each of the 16 races. Preprogrammed biases explained in the backstory mean that it is more difficult for a player to be allied with two warring races, such as Dwarves and Plaguelords, but it is possible.

Source: Wikipedia, "Warlords Battlecry III", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

80355.name: Cossacks: Back to War
80355.description:
Back to War is the second expansion pack, but it can be played as a standalone. Cossacks: Back to War adds two new nations (Switzerland and Hungary) to the choices from Cossacks: European Wars and Cossacks: Art of War because of their influence on European history. There are also new maps, a tutorial campaign and a map-editor. It adds several units to various countries, new cannon types and alters some parameters such as building time, upgrade and building costs.

Source: Wikipedia, "Cossacks: European Wars", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

80356.name: Cossacks Anthology
80356.description:
User Summary

A compilation featuring all Cossacks titles.
Cossacks: European Wars and its two add-ons, Art of War and Back to War.

80357.name: Casino Mogul
80357.description:
Casino Tycoon is a tycoon type of game where players aspire from a small unknown to a tycoon in the casino business. This game features characters such as Marlon Brando from The Godfather. One mission is for players to become the first casino to attain Five-star rating or make 50,000 pounds. Players control all aspects of the casino, including hiring staff, buying casinos, and managing the day-to-day operations. The basic aim of the game is to own and manage a casino you can buy bars, restaurants, restrooms in fact anything that a modern casino has within reason!

Source: Wikipedia, "Casino Tycoon (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

80358.description:
From the box:
Good co-workers and charitable donations make life easier for the zoo director. If he uses the donations skillfully, he will acquire additional animals and vending stalls. If done right, he can make the zoo even more attractive and new to those who visit. In this way, he will attract more visitors and earn more income.
With correct management of these new resources, a player can become the Zoo BOSS.

Gameplay:
Beside the money you have a new currency: the donations.
Donations you get f. e. when filling the small, new sponsor enclosure (you also get point tiles).
You can use donations as money but just for specific things.
For example for things on the new supply board.
That can be animals, vending stalls or co-workers.
The last you can place on the new office board.
Depending on the office you choose the co-worker has different effects.
For example earning more donations, extra points for vending stalls, extra points for bought tiles and additional extra point tiles.

Contents: 
5 expansion boards, 1 supply board, 20 supply tiles, 5 office boards, 12 co-workers, 30 donation tiles 20 point tiles

Expands:

Zooloretto




Home Page & Newsletter:

www.zooloretto.com




(German, english, dutch, hungarian, spanish, swedish)
80358.name: Zooloretto Boss

80359.name: Venarive
80359.description:
From the back of the book

Venârivè is the expansive region of northwestern Lýythia, where for thousands of years peoples, religions, and nations have developed, traded, and clashed. It includes all the lands around the Venârian Sea and the regions which lie to the north and west, including the powerful empires of Ázeryàn and Dalkésh, the kingdoms of Tríerzòn and Shôrkýynè, and the lesser states of Hârn and Iváe.

This publication provides background information on the diverse cultures, religions, and realms of the region, complemented by maps and images that illustrate its history, climate, weather, trade routes, and much more. It also includes a geopolitical index describing all the places noted on the accompanying multi-layered map.

This is the essential guide for those looking to fully understand and explore the world of Hârn.

80360.name: Against the Darkness
80360.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

The world of Against the Darkness is very similar to the world we all know. However, bogey men, ghosts, pucks, and other malicious spirits haunt the landscape. The monsters flit through the shadows, striking from closets, laundry chutes, under the bed, and behind trees. Children are their primary food, drawing their sustenance from the hopes, dreams, and creativity of the youngest among us. To make matters worse, adults, most of who were drained by the creatures of darkness years ago, can’t see them. To skeptical parents and others, the haunters are only figments of a child's imagination. They have no idea how serious the threat is.

There are only a few that bravely stand against the growing darkness. For centuries people have commented on their cats staring into corners, dogs barking at nothing in the darkness, birds fleeing right before a disaster strikes, and other strange behavior. Most people would be surprised that the animals aren't insane or merely reacting to bugs or changes in magnetism. In truth, the animals are waging a violent, brutal war against the forces of the Darkness. The future of mankind hangs in the balance.

80361.name: Venarive Player Guide
80361.description:
From the back of the book

Venârivè is the expansive region of northwestern Lýythia, where for thousands of years peoples, religions, and nations have developed, traded, and clashed. It includes all the lands around the Venârian Sea and the lands which lie to the north and west, including the powerful empires of Ázeryàn and Dalkésh, the kingdoms of Tríerzòn and Shôrkýynè, and the lesser states of Hârn and Iváe.

This guide provides a general overview for players of characters in this wide area, and is an essential support for those playing in the world of Hârn.

80362.name: Action Home Video
80362.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

What is this game about?
Action Home Video (A.H.V) is an unabashed celebration of straight-to-VHS action movies that populated video stores in the eighties. This film genre is known as Actionsploitation.

Okay, what exactly is Actionsploitation?
Everything that is awesome, and at the same time awful with action movies. Each AHV game should be overflowing with machismo, hamfisted plots, terrible one liners, senseless violence, stereotypical portrayals of the human race, explosions, bullets, bad acting, and oh ya BADASSERY!

Most righteous! What do you need to play?
Beer (if of legal drinking age), six-sided dice, paper, pencils (sharpened for use as throwing weapons), bad 80's music, and no dignity.

80363.name: Nemesis of the Roman Empire
80363.description:
Continuing on the traditions of the original, award-winning Celtic Kings: Rage of War title, The Punic Wars (aka Nemesis of the Roman Empire) explores the three Punic wars fought by Rome and Carthage between 264 BC and 146 BC and includes the famous campaigns of Hannibal and Scipio Africanus. This game introduces new nations, units, upgrades, and strategies while preserving the fresh and unique gameplay of its highly acclaimed predecessor.

Source: The Developer Website.

80364.name: Ledenheim
80364.description:
From the back of the book

One of the largest and wealthiest kingdoms of Hârbáal, Lédenheim has long been conservatively governed, but new blood in its Royal Council presages a new era of expansion eastward into the wilderness and the disorganised states of Huriséa beyond. Such promise could turn to turmoil, however, should the royal succession be disputed. The threat of outright war in the east looms should Shôrkynì Aneóla make a countermove, Quârphic tribesmen resist, or the Huriséan princes unite in opposition.

80365.name: And Other Stories...
80365.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

Welcome to And Other Stories, the generic competitive collaborative storytelling game. Have you always wanted to tell a fairy-tale? Do you enjoy giant robots battling it out in zero-gravity? Do you want to write your own police drama on the spot? Well this is the game for you.

Over three Acts, players take turns to frame Scenes using their characters as the Protagonist. Other players can enter the Scene joining him/her as Allies. Each Active player in the Scene takes the narrative reigns in turn and use their characters' Attributes to drive the story forward - each contributing to the unravelling plot as the game progresses. At the end of the Scene the Protagonist and Allies roll Fable dice to make the outcome of the Scene a success. But be warned! The Antagonist will thwart Ambitions, abuse Talents and play up Limitations using the dreaded Foil dice. Will the Protagonist and his Allies prevail over their antagonistic rival? Or will the Scene descend into tumult? As the Scene ends, the lights fade and the spotlight shines on a different Protagonist.

80366.name: Useless!: The Game of Misplaced Super Powers
80366.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

Useless! is an action/comedy role-playing game about extraordinary people in ordinary situations. Players take on the roles of heroes from comic books, movies, sci-fi novels, epic poetry, or possibly even some of the heroes of "real" life. They then make use of the awesome powers that these beings possess to perform perfectly ordinary, everyday chores like driving to WalMart to get diapers for your Aunt, harvesting clams on the Jersey shore, competing in a high school track meet, or stealing a live Komodo Dragon from the London Zoo.

80367.name: Koladis
80367.description:
From the back of the book

In TR478 Clan Tarkenby acquired Koladis sparking a bitter feud with Clan Kalinby. Even when the Crown took over, the rivalry barely abated. For more than two centures, inter-clan conflict has been the norm in Koladis. Last month the Kalinby mill burned down...

No-one thinks it was an accident, and theyoung Governor, new to his post, has no idea how he will keep the peace...

80368.name: Stone Age
80368.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

Needed Equipment

Playing cards, with Jokers. 1 deck for up to GM+3 players; and additional deck for each addition 3 players.
Writing implements and surfaces.
These rules.

Setting

You are a group of stone age people. You each have one character, living in the temperate plains. Survive and thrive if you can... You might not even be people, since this isn't Earth... but Tellus, where magic exists.

80369.name: Kethira
80369.description:
From the back of the book

Kethira describes the world beyond the misty Harnic Isles. Explore the three continents of Lythia, Mernat and Kamerand, and vast worlds beyond. Follow the rise and fall of empires and peoples throughout history in maps and chronology.

This module, through fifteen, full-colour, full-page maps and accompanying text, describes the history, politics, geography, climate, precipitation, winds, currents, tectonics and natural vegetation of the whole world of Kethira. Also covered are the night skies, and the Kethrian family of Worlds.

There is a wide worldf out there... all here to see!

80370.name: Echoes of Joshua
80370.description:
As Charles Dickens would say...

Joshua was dead, to begin with. There is no doubt whatever about that.

However, Joshua had secrets that he took to the grave. And he intends to keep it that way.

Echoes of... is a GM-less story-telling game system of players wanting something from a ghost who is getting progressively more dangerous as the players get closer to the truth.

80371.name: Josefin Skolhjälp: Engelska
80371.description:
User Summary

Pedagogical game for school children. Intended to teach basic English as a foreign language. Teaches words and sentences, with special training words for time, direction and colour.

Target for ages between 6 and 12 years.

From distributors homepage (in Swedish)

"Josefin besöker Inspector Scotty på Scotland Yard. De mystiska mästertjuvarna Mr Blue Potato, Mr Yellow Potato och Mr Red Potato går runt i London och stjäl från några av Londons mest berömda och kända platser, Du följer med Josefin i London och ska hjälpa polismannen Bobby med att leta efter spår. "

80372.name: Josefin Skolhjälp: Engelska 2
80372.description:
User Summary

Pedagogical game for school children. Intended to give continued training in English as a foreign language. Teaches words and sentences, with special training words for time, direction and colour.

Target for ages between 6 and 12 years.

80373.name: Horoscope
80373.description:
From the Game's Introduction.


People have always looked to the stars for guidance. Astrology is one of the oldest methods of fortune telling, and the stars were named to help sailors and travelers easily find their way at night. The signs are linked to birth, forever marking those born under them with certain aspects and emotions. The stars of the horoscope provide many ways of helping mankind.

But what of those times when mankind, or any creature, needs more than simple guidance? What of those times when the world is threatened? How will the stars help when the very world is in danger?

The stars provide...

There always seems to be a leader when the world needs it most. Generals that lead wars to defeat a great enemy, men and women who fight injustice with the simple means of passive resistance, and everyday people who deal with extraordinary circumstance regardless of whether they may live or die. These people are great in their own ways, but sometimes the world needs a little help from the stars themselves. That's when a Horoscope appears.

This person, be they man or woman, human or alien, appears at a time when the world is in crisis. They can tap into the very stars themselves, using the elements and aspects of the zodiac to help avert disaster. However, they have a limited lifespan. With each zodiac called upon, the Horoscope spirit leaves their body. In essence, they may use their powers twelve times before they pass into nothingness. A Horoscope is a powerful being, but they of limited life and they know this fact. Yet even with this knowledge, they continue on, trying to save the world from the evils that ravage it.

80374.name: Bris Brygga
80374.description:
Subtitle: Den grå döden, del 2

Back of the book
JAKTEN FORTSÄTTER
Ni har med nöd och näppe överlevt en brutal konfrontation med mystiska fiender bland Nekropolis ruiner. Ni har utdelat ett svårt slag mot de dolska krafter som ligger bakom Ulvrikets militära erövringar, men ännu är inte kampen vunnen. Många frågor återstår att lösa.

Vem är Rutger?
Var finns han?
Och vad innebär DAGEN?

Jagade av skoningslösa agenter för Ulvrikets armé och era mystiska fiender måste ni finna gåtornas lösning och stoppa den Grå Döden innan det är försent, både för er själva och för de fria staterna i Skandinavien.

BRIS BRYGGA är den avslutande delen i äventyrsserien Den Grå Döden. Den kan spelas separat från del 1, Nekropolis.

User translation
Brisbridge - The Gray Death, part 2
The hunt continues
You narrowly managed to survive a brutal confrontation with mysterious enemies in the ruins of Nekropolis. You have dealt a severe blow to the hidden powers who are responsible for the military conquests of Ulvriket (the Wolfrealm), but the battle is not yet won. Many questions remain unanswered.

Who is Rutger?
Where is he?
And what is meant by DAGEN (THE DAY)?

Pursued by ruthless agents from the army of Ulvriket and your mysterious enemiesyou have to find the solution to the riddles and stop the Grå Döden (Gray death) before it is too late, both for yourself and for the free countries of Scandinavia.

Bris Brygga (Brisbridge) is the final part in the adventure series Den Grå Döden (The Gray Death). It can be played as a stand-alone module without having played part 1, Nekropolis.

80375.name: Josefin Skolhjälp: Mystery in London
80375.description:
User Summary

Pedagogical game for school children. Intended to teach basic English as a foreign language. Teaches words and sentences, with special training words for time, direction and colour.

Target for ages between 6 and 9 years.

From distributor's homepage (in Swedish)

"Josefin har åkt till London.

Här träffar hon polisinspektör Scotty på Scotland Yard, som jagar de fruktade skurkarna Mr Potato, som går runt och stjäl från några av Londons mest berömda och kända platser, t.ex. Tower Bridge, British Museum och Big Ben.

Josefin bestämmer sig för att hjälpa till med att fånga dem. Tillsammans med polismannen Bobby beger hon sig till Londons kända platser för att leta efter ledtrådar."

80376.name: Dicey the Roleplay
80376.description:
Dicey is a fairly minimalistic roleplaying game which the characters are the dice and the dice are the characters.


User Summary:

Characters are represented by four or more six-sided specialised dice, each face of which represents a skill and characteristic. Succeeding in a task involves rolling dice and trying to match the required skill or characteristic on at least as many dice as the difficulty of the task.

Characters have four characteristics: Physical Strength, Agility, Mental Strength, Education. The value of each characteristic equals the number of faces for that characteristic.

80377.name: Josefin Skolhjälp: Första Hjälpen
80377.description:
User Summary

Pedagogical game for school children. Intended to teach first aid and other thing to do when an accident happens. Also learns the importance of early help.
Target for ages between 6 and 12 years.

From distributor's homepage (in Swedish)

"Lär om första hjälpen - Bamseakuten I spelet går vi igenom de mest grundläggande förutsättningarna kring första hjälpen - hur man ringer efter hjälp via 112, hur man hanterar en olycka, vad livräddande första hjälp är, och hur man känner igen en farlig situation."

80378.name: Zombies!!! Board Game
80378.description:
User Summary

Zombies!!!: The Video Game is a video version of the classic board game. It features new 3-D board graphics and enhanced gameplay.

80379.name: Hârnlore (Issue 1, Spring-1987)
80379.description:
Articles Include:

Rain in Ramala - Fiction for the Thardic Republic
Character Profile - Thardic mercenary
Meldun Manor - A Chybisan frontier manor
Invarny - A ruined manor and bizarre occupant
Aging - Optional rules for Harnmaster

Usual Columns:

Edspage - Editorial ramblings
Letters - Your input, our output
Penny Arcane - A column by the designers of Harn and Harnmaster (Future timelines of Harn)
Feedback - Questionnaire. Lets hear from you.

80380.name: Hârnlore (Issue 2, Summer-1987)
80380.description:
Articles Include:

Reports to Council - Letters to the Council of Eleven (Kaldor's route to the sea)
Escorsen's Herimtage - The lair of a Morgathian cleric
Character Sheet - A cheery soul to complement the plans above
Columbia Folk - Everything you ever wanted to know about the people who bring you Harn

Usual Columns:

Edspage - Editorial ramblings
Letterdemain - Your letters, our sleight of hand
Dicey Business - The publisher speaks
Penny Arcane - A column by the designers of Harn and Harnmaster (Pronunciation guide)

80381.name: Josefin Skolhjälp: Geografi-Expedition: Sverige
80381.description:
User Summary

Pedagogical game for school children. Intended to teach Swedish geography, sights, dialects etc.
Target for ages between 6 and 12 years.

From distributor's homepage (in Swedish)

"Många barn vill gärna lära sig var Sveriges olika städer ligger.I Expedition:Sverige tar Josefin med sig barnen på en lärorik resa runt Sverige.
Följ med Josefin på en spännande resa i Sverige och lär om:Placeringen av de största svenska städerna på kartan, Kompassriktningarna Norr, Söder, Öster och Väster, Svenska sevärdheter, Dialekter i Sverige... ...allt i syfte att ge barnen kunskap om Sveriges geografi tillsammans med Josefin! "

80382.name: Josefin Skolhjälp: Kroppen
80382.description:
User Summary

Pedagogical game for school children. Intended to teach anatomics, the circulatory system, digestion, the brain, senses etc.

Target for ages between 6 and 12 years.

From distributor's homepage (in Swedish)

"Fredo och hans farbror Professorn är varelser från yttre rymden som gärna vill lära sig något om människorna. Därför "beamar" de upp Josefin till sitt rymdskepp så att de tillsammans kan gå på upptäcktsfärd i kroppens mysterier."

80383.name: Hârnlore (Issue 4, Winter-1987
80383.description:
Articles include:

Hunting - A hunting we will go
Dogs - A character's best friend
Tyana's Shade - A ghostly mini-encounter

Usual Columns:

Editorial - Editorial ramblings
Letterdemain - Your letters, our sleight of hand
Dicey Business - The publisher speaks
Penny Arcane - A column by the designers of Harn and Harnmaster (In Search of Panaga)

80384.name: The Third War of Tyrathia
80384.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

Tyrathia, a newly formed world, has begun to spawn life in its most simple forms. But before even the first sparks of life ignite, three Gods from a distant plane arrive, with the thought of claiming the world as their own. Each escaping their home for different reasons, they attempt to share the planet and to live in separate regions. For many years, the three Gods are content as they help to shape the world around them. But one by one, they all began to believe that they should rule over the others. What started as talks quickly became battles and so began the war.

For thousands of years, the new races fought in the name of their creators until most of those suited for war had fallen. All of the races and the gods saw extinction on the horizon and called for a truce.

A few millennia have pasted since the end of the second war. The descendants of the gods are very different now. Instead of being comprised of a single God, they have all started to assimilate into one another. They now share traits of all three Gods. They no longer wish to conquer the world for a single God, instead they wish to conquer it for themselves. Thus began the Third War. The creatures of the world now battle each other in petty battles over land, resources or dominance.

80385.name: Josefin Skolhjälp: Lär att Läsa
80385.description:
User Summary

Pedagogical game for school children. Intended to stimulate reading. Contains four books with animations and 5 minigames each.

From distributor's homepage (in Swedish)

"I Lär Dig Läsa med Josefin besöker barnen det magiska biblioteket, där böckerna blir levande och Josefin är redo att hjälpa dem att uppleva de fyra spännande böckerna. Var och en av böckerna har sin egen berättelse med fem speluppgifter på vardera tre svårighetsnivåer.
De fyra böckerna är: Piratboken Kapten Enben, Sjuksköterskeboken
Fröken Febermild, Prinsessboken Prinsessan Gyllenhår och Mekanikerboken Micke Mekaniker."

80386.name: Hârnlore (Issue 5, Spring-1988)
80386.description:
Articles include:

Trail's Peril - A Gargun scenario
Master's Grimoire - A selection of Jmorvi Spells

Usual Columns:

Editorial - Editorial ramblings
Letterdemain - Your letters, our sleight of hand
Dicey Business - The publisher speaks
Penny Arcane - A column by the designers of Harn and Harnmaster (Fate, Runestones and Tarot)

80387.name: Hârnlore (Issue 6, Summer-1988)
80387.description:
Articles include:

Report to Council - The Chybisan Succession
Innkeeper - The Inns and Outs of Taverns
Namal-Kandair - A Tempest in a Trunk

Usual Columns:

Editorial - Editorial ramblings
Letterdemain - Your letters, our sleight of hand
Dicey Business - The publisher speaks
Penny Arcane - A column by the designers of Harn and Harnmaster (Where have all the graveyards gone?)

80388.name: Time Duellists
80388.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

Welcome Duellist,

You are a time traveller and you've been in a fight with your adversary for years in a row. It's a fight with no rules and it will only end when one of you will be dead. But even if you're down on the floor you can't give up. You are too proud and maybe in a different time you will get the advantage. It's time to do a time jump and prepare for a next battle.

In Time Duellist you (The Duellist) and another player (The Adversary) will fight and live through the ages. You will begin battles against each other but you can live with your life in relative safety and hope you will not be found. Through time jumps you will go to a different year and try to get an advantage there to put your adversary under the ground.

80389.name: Josefin Skolhjälp: Lär om Mat
80389.description:
User Summary

Pedagogical game for school children about food and cooking. Teaches cooking, nutrition, international food etc. Also includes 125 recipies.
Intended for ages between 6 and 12 years.
From distributor's homepage (in Swedish)

"Den här gången utspelar sig Josefins äventyr i köket. Josefin ska laga mat till sina vänner, men receptboken är tom! Som tur är finns de roliga köksnissarna. De kan ge henne sina favoritrecept och Josefin kan också passa på att ta del av deras roliga äventyr. När receptboken är full innehåller den 120 smaskiga recept, och Josefin har då lärt sig ett och annat om mat och matlagning som kan vara bra att veta."

80390.name: Lucha Libre the RPG
80390.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

Inspired by the high flying adventures of the Lucha Libre world and masked wrestlers, this RPG is as much about wrestling as adventure. In it you take on the role of an honorable Luchador battling their way through a world of corruption and evil ruods inside the ring. Using a point based system to create your Wrestler, you can choose skills and from a number Moves, Holds, and Pins to do battle inside and out of the ring.

You start out in the lowest rungs of La Liga de los luchadores enmascarados, The League of Masked Wrestlers, on a tour that criss-crosses the countryside looking for places to hold matches to you may advance up the rungs and to get yourself ready for the eventual return to the big cities where the real competition will held during the winter. Along the way you will meet other Luchadores both friendly and felonious and quite possibly from the corrupting and cunning counter league of La Liga de los Diablos Magnífico.

Adventures you can have will range from defending towns from invading aliens to wrestling ancient Aztec mummies to possibly saving the world from unknown dark gods all with the power of your Lucha!

80391.name: Josefin Skolhjälp: Magi i Sagolandet
80391.description:
User Summary

Pedagogical game for school children. Focus is on letters, numbers and logics.

From distributor's homepage (in Swedish)

"Det har hänt något mystiskt i Sagolandet - pixierna har förlorat sin magi! Tomtarna kan inte längre hålla ordning och de stackars feerna kan inte flyga, men även Sagolandets nya invånare stöter på problem.

De behöver verkligen din och Josefins hjälp!"

80392.name: Hârnlore (Issue 9, Spring-1990)
80392.description:
Articles include:

Godstones - Playing with Portal Power
The Heart that Broods - Legend of the "Dark Elves"

Usual Columns:

Editorial - Editorial ramblings
Letterdemain - Your letters, our sleight of hand
Dicey Business - The publisher speaks
Penny Arcane - A column by the designers of Harn and Harnmaster (Lakise Script)

80393.name: D&D Adventure Tools
80393.description:
From the WoTC website:

D&D Adventure Tools is a suite of tools designed to make adventure building easy and fun.

The D&D Adventure Tools begins with the D&D Monster Builder (currently available to subscribers in its Beta version), with other modules to be added later.

80394.name: King's Knight
80394.description:
King's Knight (キングスナイト) is a 1986 video game published by Square for the Nintendo Entertainment System (NES) and MSX. It was later re-released for the Wii's Virtual Console in Japan on November 27, 2007 and in North America on March 24, 2008.

King's Knight is often incorrectly credited both as an RPG and as Square's first development. It was in fact developed by Workss. It was, however, Square's first North American release under Square Soft, Inc., and their first release as an independent company. King's Knight saw a second release in 1987 on the NEC PC-8801 and the Sharp X1. These versions of the game were retitled King's Knight Special and released exclusively in Japan.

Nobuo Uematsu provided the musical score for King's Knight. It was Uematsu's fourth work of video game music composition.

Source: Wikipedia, "King's Knight", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

80395.name: Josefin Skolhjälp: Matterallyt
80395.description:
User Summary

Pedagogical game for school children. This game teaches math, numbers sorting etc. This is done in an unorthodox way by means of a racing game.

Intended for ages between 6 and 12 years.

80396.name: Josefin Skolhjälp: Matematik 2
80396.description:
User Summary

Pedagogical game for school children. Second game in the series intended to teach math, focus is on numbers, addition, subtraction and sorting.

Intended for ages between 6 and 12 years.

From distributor's homepage (in Swedish)

"Öva på att räkna tillsammans med Josefin!Revisorn Numriks kaffemaskinen har gått sönder. Utan kaffe kan inte Numrik räkna. Du får olika matteuppgifter samtidigt som du samlar ihop delarna till kaffemaskinen."

80397.name: Josefin Skolhjälp: Matematik 3
80397.description:
User Summary

Pedagogical game for school children. Third game in the series intended to teach math. This time the player must travel through a secret labyrinth, where guards must be defeated by solving math problems.

Intended for ages between 6 and 12 years.

From distributor's homepage (in Swedish)

"Den här gången utspelar sig Josefins äventyr i medeltida miljö. Den ettrige Räknestickan utmanar gänget att ta sig igenom hans hemliga Mattelabyrint - och är rätt så övertygad om att ingen kommer att klara det. Men då har han inte träffat Josefin och hennes vänner tidigare! Labyrinten består av olika rum som alla innehåller väktare som måste överlistas med hjälp av gängets mattekunskaper."

80398.name: Josefin Skolhjälp: Matematik – Samlingsbox
80398.description:
User Summary

Compilation of the two first mathematics games in the Josefin Skolhjälp series.

Pedagogical games for school children. The games teaches math, numbers sorting etc.

Intended for ages between 6 and 12 years.

80399.name: Advanced Tactics: World War II
80399.description:
Source: The Publisher Website.

Advanced Tactics is a versatile turn-based strategy system that gives gamers the chance to wage almost any battle in any time period. The first module in this series is Advanced Tactics: World War II, which allows gamers to hop into a Panzer and storm across Europe. Complete with a streamlined interface and an addicting style of gameplay, Advanced Tactics offers a unique and infinitely replayable experience for any strategy fan.

80400.name: Josefin Skolhjälp: Matematik - Dimma över Sifferköping
80400.description:
User Summary
Pedagogical game for school children. This game teaches math, numbers sorting etc. This time the player and Josefin must help the kind Herman Sifferson to build machine which can remove the magical fog over Sifferköping.

Intended for ages between 6 and 12 years.

From distributors homepage (in Swedish)
"Sifferköping är ett spännande land där alla invånarna älskar nya uppfinningar och knäppa mojänger. I Sifferköping uppfinner man hela tiden ny teknik och överallt finns det smarta prylar och finurliga manicker.
Tillsammans med Josefin ska du hjälpa den snälle Herman Siffersson att bygga en maskin som kan ta bort den mystiska dimma som har lagt sig mitt inne i Sifferköping."

80401.name: Battleground 1: Bulge
80401.description:
From the back of the box

BATTLEGROUND 1: BULGE is like no other historical strategy game you've ever played! With the revolutionary Battleview combat system, you can relive crucial moments during the Battle of the Bulge, the most famous American land battle of WWII. Can you hold off the advancing German war machine? Dig in with the U.S. 101st Airborne defending freedom from the Nazis at Bastogne, or ride to victory with the legendary German King Tiger tank. Take command of Peiper's infamous SS, or lead a blistering U.S. counterattack to retake Stoumont!

Completely new 3-D graphics!
Revised game engine featuring strength-point losses, enhanced unit concealment and variable A/I advantage control!
Platoon-level action at 250 meters per hex
Full-feature scenario editor
Play Head-to-Head via Modem-to-Modem, Null Modem, Play-by-E-mail or two player Hot Seat with Fog of War.
Drag-and-drop movement and combat
Simple point-and-click interface
Variable Command Control: Command some or all of your forces - ideal for novices
40 Historical scenarios covering action around Bastogne, Clervaux, Stoumont, La Gleize, St. Vith, and Rochefort!

80402.name: Josefin Skolhjälp: Miljö
80402.description:
User Summary

Pedagogical game for school children. This time he subject is the environment and global warming. The player must help Josefin in her struggle to make the earth healthier.

Intended for ages from 7 an up.

80403.name: Josefin Skolhjälp: Rymden
80403.description:
User Summary

Pedagogical game for school children. This time he subject is the environment and global warming. The player must help Josefin in her struggle to make the earth healthier.

Intended for ages between 6 and 12 years.

Back of the box (In Swedish)

Josefin och Putte är och hälsar på sina utomjordiska vänner professorn och hans brorson Fredo när det inträffar något otroligt märkligt - alla planeterna i solsystemet stjäls av några fräcka planettjuvar! Nu börjar en jakt för att rädda alla planeterna och samtidigt samla kunskap om rymden som Josefin måste ha för att komma vidare på sitt äventyr. Spelet är proppat med spännande fakta och roliga spel.

80404.name: Carrier Strike
80404.description:
From the game manual:

CARRIER STRIKE simulates naval-air battles in the South Pacific during WWII. CARRIER STRIKE can be used to recreate historical battles or random-historical battles (battles that could have happened at a particular time). The Campaign Game allows you to complete one battle and jump immdediately into a new battle. Ships sunk or badly damaged in one battle will be unavailable for the next battle. The Campaign game allows one battle per month from May 1942 to June 1944.

In CARRIER STRIKE you issue movement orders to friendly Task Forces (TFs) and direct the Flight Operations on your carriers. Flight operations consist of selecting ordnance for bombers; moving aircraft from the hangar to the flight deck; launching aircraft on CAP, search and strike missions; and selecting or changing strike targets.

80405.name: Naked in Space (Bare Nekkid Edition)
80405.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

Welcome to the 24 Hour Role-Playing Game Naked in Space. Did the title grab you? I hope so. Any nakedness in this game is up to you, but that’s not what it’s about. The 'naked' in Naked in Space is more of a reference to the bare bones rules system, and the 'in Space' because this is Pulp Sci-Fi.

My goal with this quickie RPG is quick and simple rules and a bit of hearty emphasis on fun in a pulp sci-fi setting. And if you don't like pulp sci-fi, so what, dump the setting and use the rules. It's your game. I'm not going to go into the ins and outs of role-playing; I'm going to presume that as you've got this far you know what a Role-Playing Game is so you know what you're looking for and you know what all this nonsense is about.

80406.name: Josefin Skolhjälp: Bokstavsdjungeln
80406.description:
User Summary

Pedagogical games for school children. Teaches various aspect of the Swedish language, like words, grammar, phonetics, spelling etc.

Intended for ages between 6 and 12 years.

80407.name: The Shadowed Keep
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
80407.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Book 3 of the Bone-Hilt Sword campaign. An intrepid band of adventurers brave the frigid wilderness of the vast Northern Territories in search of an evil artifact known as the Bone-Hilt Sword, and some only to satisfy their thirst for wealth and treasure. But will they survive the armies of undead, dragons, and creatures of the cold northern lands? Play as the third part of the Bone-Hilt Sword campaign, or as a stand-alone adventure.

This all new adventure includes;

4 complete modules
60+ defined chambers * 9 new creatures
10 Open Gaming Content (OGC) items
10 detailed adventure maps
19 pre-generated PC templates (including 8 new PC classes unique to the Usherwood Adventures setting)




Designed for First Edition and OSRIC fantasy-based role-playing game systems. Suggested No. PC's: 4-7 Suggested levels: 3-5 The Shadowed Keep is an Usherwood Adventure for character levels 3-5 , designed for First Edition and OSRIC(TM) fantasy-based roleplaying game system.

80408.name: Josefin Skolhjälp: Svenska 2 Bevingade Ord
80408.description:
User Summary

Pedagogical game for school children. Second game in the series intended to teach the Swedish language. Teaches various aspect of the Swedish language, like words, grammar, phonetics, spelling etc

Intended for ages between 6 and 12 years.

From distributor's homepage (in Swedish)

"Öva på att läsa och stava tillsammans med Josefin. Genom spännande uppgifter där du ska hjälpa Josefin med att hitta och sätta ihop alla flygdelarna, tränar du både på att läsa och skriva!"

80409.name: The Sorcerer's Apprentices
80409.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

In this game the players are apprentices to a mighty sorcerer. They live with him in his mansion on the edge of a small town. Today he is out on business and has entrusted the apprentices to finish a magical potion he is brewing in his laboratory. Normally this would be an easy task but yesterday the sorcerer caught the apprentices doing something bad and as a punishment he transformed them all into animals. The apprentices' only hope of being transformed back is to skillfully finish the magical potion in time. Failure is not an option but it is not easy gathering ingredients or working in a laboratory when you are in the shape of an animal.

80410.name: Monster Hunter's Club
80410.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

Every child knows that monsters are real. Not just thinks, but knows. They know that the Thing Under the Bed is waiting for them to get up in the middle of the night so that it can grab their feet and pull them, screaming, under the bed with it. They know that the Thing in the Closet is waiting for the night when the closet door isn't closed properly and it can come into the bed room and steal the child's soul. They know that the Boogie Man is out there in the dark waiting for the naughty children so he can steal them away, melt their faces and turn them into another boogie man. They know that La Llorona is out their calling their names to lure them into the dark where she can kidnap them and drown them in the river. Every child knows that the monsters are real. Every child knows that the adults have forgotten this.

At some point when every adult grew up they forgot what it was that terrified them in the dark. They forgot the cold sweat as something scratched at the inside of the closet. When their own children cry out about the monsters they tell them monsters are not real. They aren't lying, they just no longer remember the truth.

It's up to the Children to stop the Monsters. No one else can.

Every child knows that they cannot fight the monsters on their own. This is why you and your friends have formed the Monster Hunter's Club. You know that if you can work together you can defeat the monsters in your neighborhood and make the nights safe for every kid at school.

80411.name: Carrier Force
80411.description:
User Summary:

Carrier Force is a game of carrier warfare in the South Pacific during World War II between Japan and the Allies (mostly U.S.).

The game includes four battles: Coral Sea, Midway, Solomons and Santa Cruz.

Carrier force may be played against a computer controlled Japanese, or by two players using the hotseat method. No Allied computer opponent is provided.

Carrier Force was one of the first games to simulate carrier warfare and was the forerunner of later games, such as Carrier Strike and the various Pacific War games by SSI and Matrix Games.

By Gary Grigsby

80412.name: Zompocalypse RPG
80412.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

The government tried to create a biological weapon that would self-terminate after infecting an area the size of a country. They tested it on a small area, and it forgot to kill itself.

The plague has hit. People are dying and not staying dead, or worse, mutating. Some of those who survived have gained psychic powers as an effect of the plague. The only hope for humanity is for the few who survived the initial infections to avoid being slaughtered by the hungry corpses that shamble around the cities and towns looking for their next meal.

You are one of the lucky, if that's how you choose to view it, survivors. Make friends and hope you can trust them to watch your back while you search for a fortifiable location and defend it from the hordes that swarm at night. Run to the towns and find supplies, weapons, and gear for defenses as you wait for the rescue everyone prays will come, and no one expects will.

How will you choose to survive?

80413.name: Josefin Skolhjälp: Trafiksäkerhet
80413.description:
User Summary

Pedagogical game for school children. Teaches how to behave in the traffic, including safety, rules and road signs. Focus is on security while walking.

Intended for ages between 6 and 12 years.

From distributor's homepage (in Swedish)

"Lär att ta dig fram tryggt i trafiken! Josefin har fått möjlighet att gå med i skolpatrullen. Öva på trafikregler, vägskyltar och på att färdas tryggt i trafiken!"

80414.name: Josefin Skolhjälp: Trafiksäkerhet 2
80414.description:
User Summary

Pedagogical game for school children. Second traffic security game in the series. Teaches how to behave in the traffic, including safety, rules and road signs. This time the focus is on bicycling.

Intended for ages between 6 and 12 years.

Back of the box (In Swedish)

Josefin har fått sommarjobb som cykelbud. Men innan hon kan kalla sig cykelbud måste hon göra cykelbudsprovet. Det finns många roliga utmaningar när du skall cykla med Josefin genom staden. Det gäller bland annat att kunna känna igen en farlig trafiksituation, hjälpa barn att cykla riktigt, hitta rätt utrustning till cykeln och att lära sig om bromssträckor. Samtidigt skall du styra Josefin runt i staden och klara uppdrag åt dess invånare.

80415.name: Josefin Skolhjälp: Vikingarna
80415.description:
User Summary

Pedagogical game for school children. This time he subject is the Vikings, what they did, how they lived, their religion etc.

Intended for ages between 6 and 12 years.

Back of the box (In Swedish)

Följ med Sven Tveskägg på hans vikingaskepp! För att hjälpa Sven erövra Englands tron och visa att han är en riktig kung, måste du och Josefin åka på vikingatåg och samla in olika kungagåvor från härskare runt om i världen. Under färden får du se hur vikingarna levde, hur de handlade och kämpade för tusen år sedan.

80416.name: Gym, Tanning, Laundry: The Jersey Shore Role-playing game
rpg: Gym, Tanning, Laundry: The Jersey Shore Role-playing game
80416.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

GTL: The Jersey Shore role-playing game allows you to become a Guido or a Guidette and experience life as a club-hopping twenty something who lives for nights and weekends. You might have a job, but it's no big deal. You work just enough to pay your bills and make it to the Shore for the weekend. With any luck, you're able to save up enough to spend a week or more at the Jersey Shore for the summer.

The game is more strongly controlled than many RPGs with characters actions governed by the Time Matrix, a weekly schedule of their activities. The Time Matrix is used to control character actions and to help pace the game. It also makes it possible to play the game with no gamemaster if desired.

It's a world where appearance is king and you are who you're with!

80417.name: Uncertain Worlds or: Heisenberg's Revenge
80417.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

The last world war ended almost as soon as the machines began to malfunction. By then, most of the old ideologues were dead - victims of their own fanaticism. Use of humankind's newest weapon, the Quantum Bomb, effected damage on a far subtler level then the cities it flattened.

A wave of subatomic chain-reactions propagated beyond the blast zones. Where the waves met they twisted and strengthened. Around the world, electrical systems began to quietly shut down and vehicles stalled out on the interstate and back-country roads. Eventually, even the lights went out.

Some side effect of the quantum weapons brought the Uncertainty Principle into the macro world. Complex machines and electronics simply stopped working. Even simple machines tended to gum up and break down when they weren't being watched.

Biological and chemical systems seem to be completely unaffected, but the damage had been done; almost overnight the technological world was plunged back into the pre-Industrial era.

Welcome to the Uncertain World.

80418.name: Watchmen
80418.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

The Age of Gears lasted long into the nineteenth century. And then the darkness came. One day, the skies darkened into night and the morning did not dawn. Darkness covered the world. Within days most higher life forms were dead or dying. Mankind had a small supply of food but in a world without refrigeration, soon mankind was dying. After a few months, the only living creatures on Earth were the clockmen. Confusion nearly did them in, there was no one left to serve. Up until then most clockmen were stationary, grandfatherly figures who taught young people in living rooms, or student from the front of university classroom. The construction factories researched better and better self-ambulating designs.

Just as suddenly as it started, the darkness ended 122 years later. During that time, the clockmen transformed themselves into the image of their former makers. Mobile clockmen wore clothes and bustled about the cities in harsh whisper of whirring gears and clanking latches. To differentiate themselves from their forefathers, the mobile clockmen started referring to themselves as watchmen. This is their story.

80419.name: Objects and Objectives
80419.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

Welcome to Objects and Objectives. While in most role playing games the characters we control are Elvish warriors, grizzled space marines or drunk detectives and go on epic adventures in search of fame and glory in O&O you play as an item and have to manipulate other characters to do your bidding. It is no easy task for those who possess you may wish to destroy you if your dark secrets are revealed.

80420.name: Hop Scotch
80420.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

Hop Scotch is a game about human tragedy, misery, World War II drama, and spinning around until you're dizzy!

You, and the other players, play characters residing in the Auschwitz-Birkenau concentration camp, on their last legs and at wits end. You are in ill spirits, and know that the end is near, but the bitter-sweet prison wine someone made up is getting you by for tonight.

80421.name: The Ardennes Offensive
videogameseries: Decisive Battles of World War II
videogamehonor: 1997 Charles S. Roberts Best Twentieth Century Computer Wargame Nominee
80421.description:
From the game manual:

THE ARDENNES OFFENSIVE is the first in a new generation of World War II operational level games from Strategic Studies Group. It is a simulation of the last great German offensive in the west, popularly known as the Ardennes Offensive or the Battle of the Bulge. The Offensive, which commenced in December 1944, achieved some early success against the surprised American forces and a limited breakthrough by German panzer elements reached Dinant on the Meuse River - albeit temporarily. Without adequate air cover or supply, and against a battle hardened and resolute opponent, the plan was fore-doomed to failure but some 100,000 Americans, and an even greater number of Germans, would fall before the last blitzkrieg was stopped and the inexorable Allied drive to Berlin resumed.

The game's scenarios cover the most exciting aspects of the battle, including a campaign game which allows you to refight the entire conflict. A tutorial scenario covering the initial German drive to Bastogne takes you through the game mechanics.

User Addendum:

Although listed as Win95, this game is compatible with Win98 and XP, according to the SSG US website. The game is also available as a free download at that site: http://www.ssgus.com/index.htm (click on 'Downloads')

80422.name: Fish Fillets 2
80422.description:
User Summary

Step-based puzzle game revolving around pushing and manipulating objects with a variety of playable characters offering different mechanics.

80423.name: Blip & Blop: Balls of Steel
80423.description:
User Summary

Blip & Blop: Balls of steel is a small, free game. In the game you play one of the two balls which are heavily armed. They discover that the good man: Dr. Gorgomel is killed and the snuffs (smurfs) did it. So let's start out killing all the snuffs.

Later on in the game you also have to kill Scare Bears, Mario, Lara Croft, ...

Blip & Blop is a 2D scrolling game.

80424.name: Invasion Force
80424.description:
From back of the game box:

As the Commander-in-Chief of the invasion forces, the player is presented with a vast choice of actions and possibilities. Based on WWII, but not on a specific event, Invasion Force is not limited by historical facts, unit types or strengths. The player has FULL command from the receipt of the coded message to invade, capture or destroy. Choose from a large scale infantry attack, a small elite group of commandos, fly in paratroops or send in the tanks and artillery.

Game features include, demonstration games, 3 levels of difficulty, save game facility, large, fast scrolling map, and a smaller tactical map for easy position location, hidden or visible movement, land sea and air battles, demolition and air-landed units, transport for artillery and infantry, easy icon selection, 1 or 2 player option. Joystick recommended.

80425.name: Battle at Bull Run
80425.description:
(From the website)

The first major battle of the Civil war, Bull Run (also known as First Manassas) was a contest of tactical opportunities lost. Featuring a brilliant flanking march by Union forces under General Irvin McDowell that caught the Confederate General Beauregard by surprise on his weak east flank, the Union army failed to roll up the Confederate line due, in great measure, to the famous stand by General Thomas Jackson's Virginia brgade, which was said to have stood "like a stone wall". On the other side of the tactical ledger, General Beauregard's plan to drive across Bull Run on the west side to Centerville, thus cutting the Union army off from its supplies and communications, failed due to poorly communicated orders. Battle at Bull Run is a simulation of historical events of July 21, 1861 intended to give a feeling for the historical decisions required by the two army commanders in a fast play format.

* Two-Person or Solitaire Play
* Color Five-Page Game Rules Manual
* Upgraded Game Map In Full Color
* Larger Game Map Now 15 x 11 Hexes
* 25 Upgraded 3/4" Counters
* Two Union Units Added To Order of Battle
* Solitaire Play Rules
* Available in PDF Format

80426.name: Task Force 1942
80426.description:
Task Force 1942: Surface Naval Action in the South Pacific is a DOS PC game, released by MPS Labs (MicroProse) in 1992.

The game is a surface naval simulation which allows the player to operate single ships or a task force made up of ships, from the United States Navy (USN), Royal Australian Navy (RAN) and Royal New-Zealand Navy (RNZN), or the Imperial Japanese Navy (IJN) in the South Pacific during WWII. It was designed to run under PC-DOS or MS-DOS, version 5.0 or higher. The specific historical setting was the series of ferocious naval engagements fought around the largest island in the Solomon Islands chain, Guadalcanal, in 1942, including the following:

Battle of Tassafaronga
Battle of Empress Augusta Bay
Naval Battle of Vella Lavella
Battle of Savo Island
Battle of Cape Esperance
First and Second Naval Battle of Guadalcanal
Battle of Kula Gulf

Source: Wikipedia, "Task Force 1942", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

80427.name: The General
80427.description:
From the Back of the Game Box:

By Ian Williams.

A 3D graphical representation of warfare in the Napoleonic era.

In 'The General' you see the conflict unfold before you from a first-person point of view. Distant troops are only identifiable by using a telescope, units may be obscured by buildings, orders take time to reach the units to which they have been issued and reports from your Brigade Commanders may be lost on their way back to you.

These features along with many others, make 'The General' exceptional. The standard 'birds-eye view' has been replaced by the 'General's-eye view' and communication problems added to give the players a taste of the real difficulties faced by the generals of that time.

Assume the role of The General of the Grand Army and experience the authentic atmosphere of Napoleonic Warfare.

80428.name: SuperPower
80428.description:
A truly unique military and geo political simulator which allows theplayer the ability to decide on how they want to play the game. Built using recent UN and CIA data the player can play as any 1 of 140 nations and strive to solve the real world economic, social and political roblems facing that country.

From a military standpoint there are up to 4000 unique deployable units which can be used to fight strategic battles anywhere around the globe.

Source: The Developer Website.

80429.name: SuperPower 2
80429.description:
Like it's predecessor, SuperPower 2 is a geopolitical simulation game built around the following three aspects: political, economic and military.

Players set their own objectives and try to achieve them within a set time. For example, a player might decide to balance resources, hunt rebels or conquer the world. The computer controls the other countries which have their own objectives. When objectives come into conflict, the player must manage these relationships, form alliances and go to war.

Compared to the original game, SuperPower 2 has been generally improved, both in gameplay and graphics, and now features multiplayer support.

Source: The Developer Website.

80430.name: Games Review (Volume 1, Issue 7 - Apr 1989)
rpgissuearticle: The article that needs no introduction!
A Dream is but a Shadow...
80430.description:
The 7th issue of Games Review Monthly.


Contents

Regular

Editorial
The Charts
News & New Products
Letters
Subscription Form




Reviews

The Glory (Genesis Games)
The Neighbours Game (Roo’s Games)
Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay (Games Workshop)
Shadow World (Iron Crown Enterprises)
Red Storm Rising (TSR)
Advanced Dungeons & Dragons 2nd edition Players Handbook (TSR)
Albedo (Thoughts & Images)
Evolution (Pyramid Games)
Borodino (Atari Battlescapes)
The Halls of Montezuma (Electronic Arts)
Booze it or Lose it - The Scotch Whisky Game (Villa Games) & Against the Odds (Gimax Games)




Features

The Arab-Israeli Wars - History outline and a scenario for Test of Arms
Thunder at Cassino (Avalon Hill) - An in-depth look
Talisman (Games Workshop) - An in-depth look at this classic game
Body Shop - Vehicle design in Car Wars
Shogun - Tactics in MBs game
Modern Tactical - A look at modern tactical war games
AFL - How to start a league
Its Pays to be Paranoid - Refereeing fun in Paranoia

80432.name: Sky Kid
80432.description:
Sky Kid (スカイキッド, Sukai Kiddō) is a horizontal scrolling shooter arcade game that was released by Namco in 1985. It runs on Namco Pac-Land hardware but with a video system like that used in Dragon Buster. It is also the first game from Namco to allow 2 players to play simultaneously. The game was later released on the Famicom (brought to the American NES by Sunsoft), and both this version and the original arcade version were later released on Nintendo's Virtual Console service.

Sky Kid is a two-dimensional, scrolling shooter game. The players play as the Sky Kids "Red Baron" and "Blue Max", which are references to Manfred von Richthofen, the famous World War I flying ace, and the prestigious order Pour le Mérite, informally known as Blue Max. The Sky Kids fly around in biplanes and are assigned specific targets during the missions. These missions involve bombing specific targets. The "A" button is used to control the plane's machine gun and the "B" button is used to perform a loop.

A number of obstacles face the player in each level. First, their biplane is not equipped with a bomb to complete their mission, and must be picked up en route to the target. Second, there are both ground and air units that attempt to keep the Sky Kids from accomplishing their mission. Last, the Sky Kids may have to navigate through some very inhospitable terrain or navigate around cities in order to get to the target. The targets that the Sky Kids must bomb will either be a fortress complex or a ship. As the player moves farther up in the 9 missions, multiple targets will begin to appear in the course of one mission. Players receive points for destroying air and ground targets, receiving additional points for how many of these types of targets are destroyed. In addition, players get points based on how much of the target is destroyed.

Sometimes blowing up enemy units will reveal a hidden Namco icon or character, including Pac-Man, Inky, the Special Flag from Rally-X (which has appeared in many other Namco games) or Pooka from Dig Dug.

If the player does a loop in front of girls, the girls send out hearts representing kisses. If the player shoots them, they turn into waving dogs.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sky Kid," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

80433.name: Monday Night Combat
videogamehonor: 2010 Spike Best Downloadable Game of the Year Nominee
2011 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Downloadable Game of the Year Nominee
2011 Game Developers Choice Awards Best New IP of the Year Nominee
80433.description:
From the Developer's website:

Monday Night Combat for Xbox LIVE Arcade is a class-based, third-person shooter… and the most popular lethal sport of the future! It blends intense combat, finishing moves, and gameshow-like challenges and rewards to produce an action experience unlike any other. Why fight for "honor" or "duty" when you can fight for the real American dream: cash, fame and endorsements?

80434.name: Iron Crown Quarterly (Vol. 1, No. 4 - April Fool's Day 1989)
rpgissuearticle: An Open Notice to Star Strike Players
A Letter of Interest to all Role-Players
80434.description:
User Summary...

SYSTEMS:

For Space Master:

Asteriod Mining by Michael R. Veach
