New Professions by Todd Caldwell




For MERP:

Odds and Ends [Weapons, Professions, etc.] by Ola Haggstrom, Ulf Zindermann, Anders Blixt




For Shadow World:

Magical Metals on Kulthea by Terry Amthor




FICTION:
Part Four of Trevor's Tale! [Fiction] (uncredited)
Page One (?) [Various Humorous Articles in honor of April Fool's Day]

DEPARTMENTS:

Letter to the Editor (uncredited)
Coleman's Corner [Game Questions Answered] by Coleman Charlton
ICE Mugshots [Jessica M. Ney & Richard H. Britton] (uncredited)
Canuck Corner by Kevin 'alien' Barrett
Classifieds [Humor] (uncredited)
New Titles (uncredited)
Aston's Picks [Aston Selects Favorite Upcoming Products!] (uncredited)
Magic in the Modern World by Larry Brook
Product Listing (uncredited)
New Titles (uncredited)
Credits (uncredited)
Errata [for previous issues of IQ] (uncredited)

80435.name: Salvation (Fan Expansion for Dominion)
80435.description:
This is an unofficial fan-made expansion, is not considered part of the Dominion family, and is not affiliated with Rio Grande Games.***




From the Developer:

"The word of God has spread throughout the realm, leading to the rise of the church, and bringing peace and salvation to the faithful. Monks search their souls for illumination, priests seek to teach the grace of God, and grand towers and cathedrals are erected in his name.

But not all choose to follow in God's light - a host of heretics, pagans, and cultists threatens to destroy the sanctity of the church, risking damnation for their dark and sacrilegious ways. But who is truly without sin? The coffers of the church swell from tithe and indulgence, crusaders war and plunder in the name of God, while the inquisition silences their enemies in a wake of terror and blood.

The choice is yours: join ranks with forces of God to spread his holy word, or risk your eternal soul for unimagined power in this fan-made expansion to Dominion!"

80436.name: FUEL
80436.description:
From the game box

Extreme racing on an epic scale. Watch out for Fearsome weather. 75 vehicles to choose from, 14,000 square kilometers to explore with 190 challenges and 70 career races.

80438.name: Flags The Game
boardgamepublisher: RDN Games division of Publibec Limited
80438.description:
User Summary:
Before starting, the players decide the number of countries to "complete" in order to win the game. To complete a country the player must obtain all all three types of cards belonging to said country. The three cards are the flag, the coat of arms, and the capital.

There are two phases of play, the "road" and the "boardwalk".

The Road:
Players roll the dice and move their peg along the road traveling through 85 countries that existed during the mid 1980's. When players land on a country, they must choose which card they think they can correctly guess. When the player guesses correctly, the player obtains said card.

The Boardwalk:
A person can only move to the boardwalk when they have the necessary number of cards. For instance, if the players agreed upon 3 countries to complete, the player must obtain 3 cards of the coat of arms, 3 of the flags, and 3 of the capitals (it doesn't matter if they are of the same country or not). During the boardwalk the players have chances to take away cards from other players and to correctly guess the remaining types of cards of the countries the player has already obtained cards for.

From the Box:
Capitals - Flags - Coat of Arms in Flags The Game

For the teen who has to learn geography!
For the adult who wants to know more!
A fun game for everyone no matter what is your knowledge about geography.
You can play easily and with fun, because, Flags The Game makes a brain without strain.

Publisher:
RDN Games division of Publibec Limited
Sorel, Quebec, Canada J3P 6K5

80440.name: A Boy and his Blob:  Trouble on Blobolonia
80440.description:
A Boy and His Blob: Trouble on Blobolonia is a video game released in 1989 for the Nintendo Entertainment System (NES). The game was developed by David Crane, creator of the Pitfall! series. A Boy and His Blob follows an unnamed protagonist and his shapeshifting blob on an adventure to save the latter's home planet of Blobolonia. The gameplay revolves around feeding the blob different flavored jelly beans to change his shape into various tools in order to overcome obstacles and traverse the game's world.

Source: Wikipedia, "A Boy and His Blob: Trouble on Blobolon," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

80441.name: Josefin Skolhjälp: Svenska – Kaos i Kommaköping
80441.description:
User Summary

Pedagogical game for children. This purpose of this game is to give training in the Swedish language in a fun an entraining way. Focus is on letters, numbers and logics.

The player should together with Josefin write a book which the other citizens in Kommaköping can read.

80442.name: Digital Champ Battle Boxing
80442.description:
Digital Champ Battle Boxing is a single-player video game released in 1989 for TurboGrafx-16 by Naxat Soft. The game was released to the Virtual Console in Japan on April 15, 2008, Europe on May 16, 2008, and in North America on October 20, 2008.

The game takes place in the fictional year 20XX, with the main player as a mutant fighting hordes of boxer clones before facing off against a robotic boxer. Three clone opponents exist; Marciano, Mick and Samson. Each match is a maximum of twelve rounds, each being three minutes.

Source: Wikipedia, "Digital Champ Battle Boxing", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

80443.name: Thin Ice
80443.description:
User Summary

Inspired by the Data East game, "Disco No 1", Thin Ice originally entered development in 1982. The theme was changed to an ice skating Penguin catching polar bears and running from a seal. When Mattel Electronics landed the 1984 Winter Olympics license, the game was converted to "Voochko On Ice", using the Olympics mascot. Mattel Electronics folded before the game could be releaed, and the original Penguin theme was brought back for its INTV Corp release.

80444.name: Monopoly: Belfast Edition
80444.description:
Description: The city of Belfast has long been one of the few destinations that is able to cater for all interests, with its rich heritage of naval connections, lively arts, great restaurants and bars. And now you can tour this amazing city and all its famous locations with the new Belfast Monopoly! From Donegall Square to the Titanic Quarter, and from the Belfast Waterfront to the historic Parliament Buildings at Stormont, it’s all up for grabs as you race around the board building a property empire to beat your opponents!

It's Monopoly.

80445.name: Super Bust-a-Move
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
80445.description:
User Summary

An puzzle game in which the player attempts to clear the field of multicolored bubbles by firing bubbles one at a time into the field. When three or more bubbles of the same color touch, they burst, often causing other bubbles to fall.

Super Bust-a-Move has two different modes:
1. Puzzle Mode: player attempts to clear all bubbles
2. VS Mode: Two players try to keep their respective fields clear while attempting to fill their opponent's field with more bubbles by making combos. Can be played against another player or an A.I.

80446.description:
October, 1929: The Republic is crumbling. With the death of Gustav Stresemann on October 3, 1929 and the crash of the American Stock Exchange, Germany's recovery from the devastating Great War now is in doubt. Communist, Fascist and Republican forces clash over ideology and erupt into a war of words and violence. Unemployment begins to spiral out of control while the German people grow restless. Rallies are held by charismatic leaders as lawmakers struggle to find answers. Amongst the chaos, a new figure will head the German nation.

Weimar: German Politics 1929-1933 is a two-player political game that tries to simulate the chaos of Germany prior to Hitler's appointment to chancellor. Will you take the role of the Social Democratic leadership, staving off the extreme ideologies of Communism and Fascism? Using your political influence and paramilitary forces, will you try to gain control of the Reichstag, or send Germany to the brink of anarchy? Can you change history, or is Germany doomed to repeat it?

Weimar is a block/CDG in which one side plays the SPD and the other plays the NSDAP. A third Communist force is played by both players. Players hold rallies, street fights, build alliances, and try to win the hearts and minds of the German people.

Victory can be achieved in multiple ways, with both parties being able to gain influence in each electoral area and score them in each election phase. Influence is gained by holding rallies and bringing political and paramilitary forces to both "encourage" and intimidate the German people. Alternatively for the Nazis, they can use events to increase chaos and unrest in order to bring down the weak parliamentary government. For the SPD, they can use special actions to stop the Nazi political machine, including the elimination of its leadership.
80446.name: Weimar:  German Politics 1929-1933

80447.name: Cogsburg
80447.description:
Designer Summary:

For ages, the studious inhabitants of Cogsburg lived without fear, happily ticking along as they went about their business. But now a freak accident has occurred at the Cogtower, scattering cogs all over town and sending the clockwork winders into chaos. The Cogmen must repair the Cogtower before it is too late.

Each player directs a handful of resourceful Cogmen to gather cogs and repair the Cogtower. Each turn, a Winding card will be drawn from the deck, and any Cogmen standing adjacent to a Winder will be wound up by that amount, gaining Energy. Once all the Winding cards have been used, a Rainy Day card is added and the deck is reshuffled. If a Rainy Day card is drawn, any Cogmen who don’t find shelter will get wet and rust (a terrible fate!)

Beginning with the starting player, players take turns moving all of their Cogmen, who must spend Energy to move. At the end of the turn, any Cogmen dangerously low on Energy (and not near a Winder) may make a Desperation move, one last push towards a Winder before becoming unwound. A Cogman that becomes unwound is inoperable until he is wound up by an ally.

Cogmen gather the cogs that are scattered about Cogsburg, returning them to the Cogtower to gain victory points, or he may choose to repair a broken/rusted Cogman instead. A Cogman can only carry a single cog at a time (They’re very heavy!)

Once the Cogtower has been rebuilt, final scores are tallied. Each player recieves one Victory Point for every cog they supplied to the Cogtower, plus an additional point for each operable Cogman.

The basic game is for two players. Rules for three players and four-player team play are included. Official rules for entirely cooperative play are forthcoming.

80448.name: Ghouls 'n' Ghosts
videogameversion: North American Sega Master System edition
videogamehonor: 1989 EGM Game of the Year Winner
80448.description:
The gameplay for Ghouls 'n Ghosts is similar to that of Ghosts 'n Goblins. The player controls the knight Arthur, who must advance through a series of eerie levels and defeat a number of undead and demonic creatures in his quest to restore the souls stolen by Lucifer (Loki in the English-language Genesis/Mega Drive and Sega Master System versions), including the soul of his lover, Princess Prin Prin. Along the way, Arthur can pick up a variety of weapons and armor to help him in his quest.

To defeat the game, Arthur must complete the game twice. The first time completion allows a special weapon to appear in the next round of play. To enter Lucifer's chamber the player must have this special weapon equipped and must have defeated the final Fly boss from level 5. After entering the final large door, the player goes directly to Lucifer's chamber.

While the core gameplay remains the same as its predecessor, the game now allows Arthur to fire directly upward and directly downward while in mid air.

By jumping in certain spots, players can cause a treasure chest to erupt from the ground. By firing his weapon at the chest, players may uncover new weapons, gold armor or an evil magician that changes Arthur into an elderly man or a helpless duck. The gold armor allows players to charge up the weapon to release a powerful magical attack. Each weapon has its own special attack.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ghouls 'n Ghosts", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

80449.name: Solomon's Club
80449.description:
User Summary:

This is a Game Boy sequel to the NES title Solomon's Key. The player navigates a series of single screen maze-dungeons, attempting to secure a key and open a door to the next level without being killed by enemies.

80450.name: Gauntlet II
80450.description:
The gameplay is very similar to the original Gauntlet, a topdown dungeon crawl supporting up to four players. The biggest difference from the original game is that players can choose identical classes, instead of being limited to a particular one for each joystick; the players being differentiated by colors. Thus, instead of having a "warrior", "wizard", and "valkyrie" (for instance), in Gauntlet II there could be a "red wizard", a "blue elf" and a "green warrior".

In addition to the new "class" system, new level designs were added, including the possibility of encountering them in altered ways by having the playfield turned in steps of 90°. Level 100 was the winning design from a public competition. Other new features included the enemy "It", which upon contact would make a player "It" and draw all enemies towards him/her. The only way to release this curse is by touching another player or entering the exit, turning any level containing "It" into a fantasy filled game of tag. Other notable additions include the ability to ricochet shots off walls by means of a special pick-up, acid puddles that caused large, predetermined amounts of damage and a large dragon which would occupy multiple squares and require multiple hits to destroy.
New level elements were also added, adding more variety to the original game. These included "all walls are invisible", "magic walls" which changed into monsters or items when hit, "stun tiles" which stunned the player, and exits which flashed from functioning to non-functioning. This sequel was also the first to feature what is now known as the Gauntlet theme tune, which resembles a simplified Baroque fugue.

Source: Wikipedia, "Gauntlet II", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

80451.name: The Ren & Stimpy Show: Space Cadet Adventures
80451.description:
User Summary

This was the first of seven video games based on the mature cartoon The Ren & Stimpy Show, and the first of two to be released for Game Boy.

This game is a platformer loosely inspired by the episode Space Madness.

80452.name: The Ren & Stimpy Show: Veediots!
80452.description:
User Summary

This was the second of seven video games based on the mature cartoon The Ren & Stimpy Show, and the last of two to be released for Game Boy although it was better known as a SNES release.

This game is a platformer loosely inspired by the episodes The Boy Who Cried Rat, In the Army, Stimpy's Invention, and Marooned.

80453.name: Quest for Glory V: Dragon Fire
vgcharacterversion: Elsa Von Spielburg (Quest for Glory V)
Rasha Rakeesh SahTarna (Quest for Glory V)
80453.description:
The Rites of Rulership are about to commence, and the victor will be given the crown. The Hero enters the contest with the assistance of Erasmus, Rakeesh, and many old friends from previous entries in the series. The Hero competes against competitors Kokeeno Pookameeso, Magnum Opus, Gort, and Elsa Von Spielburg (who returns from the first game.)

As the Rites commence, however, an unknown assassin begins systematically picking off each of the contestants. Each contestant is murdered by a poison dagger, and they all are murdered near Dragon Pillars, the objects used to keep the Dragon of Silmaria locked up. After completing the third Rite, defeating the Hydra, Rakeesh is attacked by the assassin and, depending on the course of action chosen by the player, either lives or dies.The conspiracy is eventually unraveled and the Dragon, having been released due to the destruction of the Dragon Pillars, is defeated.

...

The fifth game is arguably a different genre from the first four; while the first four are mostly adventure games incorporating role-playing elements; the fifth game is a role-playing game incorporating some adventure elements. For instance, the fifth game has a wide variety of weapons, armor and magical items, whereas the first four do not. Also, in the fifth game nearly every major mission consists of going to some place and defeating some monster in physical or magical combat. Additionally, the controls and battle system are substantially different from those of the first three games and have taken the variations of the fourth game even further.

Also differentiating the fifth game from the first four were an impressive soundtrack by Emmy-winning composer Chance Thomas and a new graphics engine programmed by Eric Lengyel.

Source: Wikipedia, "Quest for Glory V: Dragon Fire", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

80454.name: Egg Mania: Eggstreme Madness
80454.description:
At the start of a level, crates begin falling from the sky. Each one has a picture of the block it contains on it. Stack these blocks and build a tower up to the hot-air-balloon to finish the level. However, it is not that simple; the water at the bottom of the level rises, and if there are any holes remaining in the tower, it gets destroyed. Also, several enemies randomly appear, some stealing your crates, and some dragging you into the water. There are also items in bubbles that give you a power-up or help to destroy an opponents towers.

Source: Wikipedia, "Egg Mania: Eggstreme Madness", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

80455.name: Mega Man Anniversary Collection
80455.description:
Mega Man Anniversary Collection a compilation of video games developed by Atomic Planet Entertainment and published by Capcom. It was released exclusively in North America on June 23, 2004 for the Nintendo GameCube and Sony PlayStation 2 (PS2) and on March 15, 2005 for the Microsoft Xbox. Mega Man Anniversary Collection contains the first eight games in the original Mega Man series, which debuted on the Nintendo Entertainment System (NES) with the first six games, moved to the Super Nintendo Entertainment System (SNES) with the seventh game, and then moved again to the PlayStation and Sega Saturn with the eighth game. The plot follows the robotic protagonist Mega Man in his continuing adventures battling the evil Dr. Wily and his army of Robot Masters.

Each game has a nearly identical gameplay structure in which the player traverses a series of themed stages to face off against boss robots, gain new weapons and abilities, then defeat Dr. Wily in a final confrontation. An extra feature is the "Navi Mode" for the first six titles, which provides hints and pathways for completing each stage. In addition to these eight games, Mega Man Anniversary Collection includes two unlockable fighting games (Mega Man: The Power Battle and Mega Man 2: The Power Fighters), which were both previously unreleased outside of Japan. These two titles are similar in gameplay but a bit more streamlined. The battles cut straight to the bosses, who get progressively more difficult with each one defeated. Other unlockables in the Mega Man Anniversary Collection include original artwork and remixed music.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mega Man Anniversary Collection", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

80456.name: FIFA Soccer 11
videogamehonor: 2010 Gamescom Best Console Game of the Year Nominee
2010 Spike Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee
2011 British Academy Game Awards Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee
2011 British Academy Game Awards Game of the Year Nominee
2011 CVA Best Console Game of the Year Nominee
2011 CVA Game of the Year Nominee
2011 D.I.C.E. Sports Game of the Year Winner
2011 Golden Joystick Best Sports Game of the Year Winner
80456.description:
User Summary

The latest update to the FIFA Series from EA Sports adds the ability to play network games where all 22 players on the pitch are controlled by human beings, more realistic passing controls, an emphasis on the individual player personality, and the ability to customize your team.

80457.name: Gran Turismo 5
videogamehonor: 2009 Gamescom Best Playstation Game of the Year Nominee
2010 Game Critics Best Racing Game of the Year Nominee
2010 Gamescom Best Console Game of the Year Winner
2010 Gamescom Best of Gamescom Winner
2011 British Academy Game Awards Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee
2011 D.I.C.E. Racing Game of the Year Nominee
2011 Japan Game Awards Game of the Year Winner
80457.description:
User Summary:

The latest iteration in the Gran Turismo series gives you the option of either career mode as a driver or managing a racing team. It introduces kart play and the ability to make your own courses.

Link to press release: http://us.gran-turismo.com/us/news/d5233.html

80458.name: The Sixth Cavalier
80458.description:
From the back of the book:

Hubrimort is a small, respectable town whose only claim to fame is a local governmental position bestowed by five of the king's chosen officials, known as the Cavaliers. The position is given to the head of one of four noble families once each decade. While competition for the mysterious position is always fierce, this year there are rumors of underhanded deals with criminals, rigged tournaments, and a nasty case of blackmail. Which of the ancient families deserves ten years of power and privilege? Only the Sixth Cavalier can help the five officials make the right choice!

80459.name: Monster Madness: Battle for Suburbia
80459.description:
From the game box:

Slash, shoot, and drive through a horde of invading monsters as you battle to save suburbia!

- Over 70 unique monster enemies!
- 4 player co-op!
- Over 20 giantic levels with intense boss fights!
- Highly interactive and destructible environments!
- Devious physical traps!
- Drive, pilot, and sail a fleet of unique monster-mashing vehicles!
- Defend your turf in chaotic, 16 player online battlefields!
- Up to 4 players can team up on one system, or take the battle online together!
- Bulid and upgrade an arsenal of incredible shooter weapons!

80460.name: The Darkness
videogamehonor: 2008 British Academy Game Awards Best Story/Narrative of the Year Nominee
2008 D.I.C.E. Best Story of the Year Nominee
80460.description:
From the game box:

You are Jackie Estacado, a hitman for the Franchetti crime family. On your 21st birthday, a timeless force known as The Darkness awakens within you. You can wreak havoc on your enemies with the powers it bestows. But you'll quickly learn that The Darkness has a will of its own...

80461.name: Tak and the Power of Juju
80461.description:
From the back of case:

The evil Tlaloc has stolen the moonstones, diminishing the powers of the Moon Juju goddess. It falls to Tak to right this wrong. He's got nothing but his wits and, um...

chicken suit!?!?!

80462.name: Play-Doh Toy Time Race Game
80462.description:
Back of box: Things are going haywire in the toy factory! It's up to you to move your toys safely along the conveyor belt and into the gift box. But watch out for the other toymakers. They'll try to squish your toys or send them off the track! The race is on to see whose toys will make it to the gift box first!

Players mold different color play doh into their game pieces. There are 4 different molds and 4 different colors of play doh. They then spin a spinner and have a choice of 3 actions: Moving along the board, truning the crank mechanism (to make the pieces turn around...either making them closer or further to the goal) or to "recycle" an apponent's game piece by squising it. The player who gets 2 of their game pieces into the gift box first is declared the winner.

80463.name: Survivor: The Interactive Game
80463.description:
User Summary

Survivor: The Interactive Game is based on the first two seasons of the television show Survivor. The player moves through a season on the show working at camp, interacting with other castaways, and competing in challenges. The player can choose to play as any of the Survivors from the first two seasons, or they can customize their own contender by altering 10 character skills. Survivors are eliminated as the game progresses until final Tribal Council where the winner is chosen.

80464.name: Metroid: Other M
videogamehonor: 2010 Spike Best Nintendo Console Game of the Year Nominee
80464.description:
The game takes place between Super Metroid and Metroid Fusion. Other M opens with a cinematic showing the final battle with Mother Brain at the conclusion of Super Metroid. After escaping the exploding Planet Zebes, Samus Aran awakens on a Galactic Federation ship. After leaving, she receives a distress signal, commonly coded as "Baby's Cry", from a dormant "Bottle Ship", which is floating a short distance away from a Federation vessel.

Gameplay is designed to allow switching between first person and third person views based on how the Wii remote is held. Environments are 3D, and Other M is the first game in the franchise to feature melee combat.

Source: Wikipedia, "Metroid other m", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

80465.name: Jak and Daxter: The Lost Frontier
videogamefranchise: Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)
80465.description:
Jak and Daxter: The Lost Frontier is the fourth game in the Jak and Daxter series of the games developed by High Impact Games and published by Sony Computer Entertainment. Gameplay is the same to other games in the Jak series, though there are flight segments. There is no Dark or Light Jak available in this game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Jak and Daxter: The Lost Frontier", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

80466.name: Alternate Reality: The City
80466.description:
Alternate Reality: The City is an RPG by Philip Price primarily developed for the Atari 8-bit. It featured a number of technological breakthroughs and an intriguing storyline.

It was to be the first of six or seven releases in the Alternate Reality series, but only it and the sequel The Dungeon were ever released.

The City opened with a cinematic sequence of being abducted by an alien ship, then stepping through a portal which assigned your stats. After that, it became a fantasy RPG set in the city of Xebec's Demise.

Source: Wikipedia, "Alternate Reality: The City," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

80467.name: Alternate Reality: The Dungeon
80467.description:
User Summary:

Alternate Reality: The Dungeon, by Philip Price, is the sequel to the RPG AR: The City. Originally designed as a single game, the publisher Datasoft split it into a sequel.

The Dungeon featured improved graphics and gameplay over the original, and featured an extensive 4-level dungeon to explore. The game was from a first-person 3-d dungeon perspective.

The Alternate Reality series was originally conceived to have many further sequels which delved further into the storyline, but these were never fully developed.

80468.name: The Harnic Herald (Fall 1999)
80468.description:
Articles include:

Green Wyvern Inn - Accommodation in Shiran on the Tharda Way

Usual Columns:

New Releases - HarnManor, HarnMaster Religion
Upcoming Releases - Barbarians of Harn, HarnMaster Bestiary, HarnWorld Reprints, Harn Computer RPG
Advertising - Harnic Miniatures (Gargun)

80469.name: The Harnic Herald (Winter 1999)
80469.description:
Articles include:

The Grich Who Stole Solstice - Christmas Adventure
Gargun Characters - Descriptions and statistics

Usual Columns:

New Releases - Harnic Barbarians, HarnManor
Upcoming Releases - HarnMaster Bestiary, HarnWorld Reprints, Harn Computer RPG
Advertising - Harnic Miniatures (The Orcs of Harn)

80470.name: The Harnic Herald (Spring 2000)
80470.description:
Articles include:

Dead Man Walking - A Morgathian rummage party
The Staff of Urda - Morgathian Holy Artefact
Spells & Invocations - Store Spirit III (Morgath), Creeping Fog of Deliquesce (Odivshe IV), Choking Fog of Deliquesce (Odivshe IV)

Usual Columns:

New Releases - HarnMaster Barbarians
Upcoming Releases - HarnMaster Bestiary, HarnWorld Reprints, Harn Computer RPG
Advertising - HarnMaster Barbarians

80471.name: Bird Strike
80471.description:
User Summary:

Bird Strike is a take on Space invaders in which the player controls a sideways-moving tank at the bottom of the screen. Aircraft come down out of the sky, and your job is primarily to destroy all 6 with a direct hit to the center of the aircraft.

If the player shoots the planes off-center, then a carrier pigeon flies across the screen. Shooting this adds a note to a musical score at the top of the screen - completing this score also completes the level.

80472.name: Valeur et Discipline
80472.description:
Valeur et Discipline is a set of rules for napoleonic wargaming with figurines al scale 1/100 or 15 mm. It's ideal for play al Corps level and with multiple players.

(From the introduction)
The players in each turn first give orders at his units, after the units are activated and declare "charge" (the enemy can react) and move (the enmey again can react or make defensive fire). The combat phase is common, with artillery fire, musket fire and melee, and ending with the moral checks.
The object of the game is to desmoralize or rout the enemy formations when they reach a determined level of losses.

80473.description:
Expansion kit for The Truckers 1st edition user.
Thus please see description of the original game about game-play and goal.

You should replace the original map with this new map.
Rules are revised and tuned-up 1st edition into high spec more enjoyable game!

components
1 new map board
1 round marker
5 order markers
1 new rule sheet

Main changing

Enhanced player-interaction with scrambling containers
Truck-introducing rule changed more flexible
Reduced disadvantage of First Player
Forbidden Negotiation
The game will end after 2nd player reached the goal, not 1st player.
Simplified and some adding of Scoring
Introduced Score Track around the game board
80473.name: The Truckers version 1.5 tune-up kit

80474.name: Busstop: The Boardgame
80474.description:
There are many types of people who arrive at a bus stop waiting to get on a bus; babies,kids, high school girls, working men, seniors and ETs(the Extra-Terrestrials). In this game it is your job to get the same type of people on to one of your buses, and to make sure your bus is full before taking them to their destinations. If you have more kinds of people than you have buses you will have to make some of them wait at the bus stop for another bus to come. If the game ends and you still have passengers waiting for a bus, you create unhappy customers and you receive negative Victory Points.

This is the new version of card game Busstop.
Cards changed into tiles, main board and player boards.
A new kind of passenger called baby introduced.
And several rules are changed.

80475.name: Kingdom of Kanday: Electronic Atlas
80475.description:
From the CD booklet

The Kanday Electronic Atlas is a versatile resource for fantasy roleplayers. The Atlas includes 69 detailed maps in Campaign Cartographer 2's vector format. The maps have been compiled from a variety of original source material or created specifically for this product.

The Atlas provides you with the tools you need to navigate quickly through individual maps; any part of the map is just a quick zoom away.

80476.name: Harn Regional Map
80476.description:
from Kelestia Productions website

The definitive version of one of the best-loved fantasy maps ever made, available in both printed and interactive multi-layered PDF file formats.

All new vegetation and relief makes geographical features clearer than ever before. This is the most detailed map of Hârn ever made.

Complete replication of all geographical & settlement features from N. Robin Crossby’s 1983 Hârn Map, with many additional features identified. There are more than 500 geographical and settlement features on this map.

This is one of the most ‘artful’ fantasy maps ever published. It looks more like a satellite photo than a topographic map, yet has all the detail of the original 1983 map (and much more).

This interactive PDF version includes details of political boundaries, areas of core and peripheral control by the various realms, the ranges of human and gârgún tribal groups, details of major and minor trade goods and trade routes, and enables the user to zoom into very high levels of detail. It also includes square and hex grids to enable location of features and the tracking of distance.

80477.name: Atlas Kelestia: Chelemby-Geltheim
80477.description:
from Kelestia Productions website

The finest atlas maps of Kethîra ever made. Now the first in what we expect to be a long series of modules. High resolution vegetation and relief maps with detailed geographical features, towns, castles, keeps, villages, sites, landmarks... in short, more detail than we have ever before put on atlas maps. Complete with comprehensive indices (almost 400 entries) for every feature on the maps.

This folio covers eight grid squares, each of which is 625 square leagues, 10,000 square km, or 3,900 square miles. Several of the grids are mostly water. (One is entirely water... except for the horrendous sea monster lurking beneath the waves).

Kingdoms and regions detailed in this Folio include: the Kingdom of Chélemby; the Hârbáalese Kingdoms of Géltheim and Ánvâl; the Thranaál of Tázel in the Hârbáalese Kingdom of Tónanby; and a range of islands off the Hârbáalese coast, including Chel Øy, Téchel Øy, Trévechel Øy, and the Ljârl, Skîvaal, and Trevéhedè Øyen.

80478.name: Tak 2: The Staff of Dreams
80478.description:
From the back of the case:

Troubled with strange dreams, Tak can feel a dark juju emanating from an unfamiliar world. Equipped with new powers, Tak bravely ventures outside the Pupanunu tribe and discovers an evil beyond his wildest dreams.

80479.name: Avatar: The Last Airbender
videogameversion: North American PlayStation 2 Greatest Hits edition
videogamefranchise: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)
80479.description:
From the back of the case:

Play as Aang, Katara, Haru and Sokka as you grow your team into an unstoppable force. Bring to life an adventure of intrigue, deception and revelation that exposes an even greater threat than the Fire Nation.

80480.name: Bionicle
80480.description:
From the back of the case:

Live the Legend

Be the heroic Toa and become the Toa of Light

Explore the island of Mata Nui

Battle the forces of evil

Use your awesome elemental powers

Ride, glide, and surf through your adventure

80481.name: Magical Devices
80481.description:
From the introduction

Magical Devices, a 1997 Gen Con supplement, celebrating the twentieth anniversary of Chivalry & Sorcery. Within the following pages are over 10 Devices of Power the GMs can place in their campaign world, or the formulas for an items creation could be found in scrolls, books, etc. by a mage that could attempt to create the item himself. Finding the materials to make the item can spin off into many new quests! Lastly, a GM can use the items provided to get ideas on how to create his own Devices of Power for his campaign world.

We also provide three sample creatures from our upcoming creatures Bestiary, some expanded rules concerning the creation of Devices of Power, and specific magical effects of a creatures remains.

80482.name: The Sims 2: University Life Collection
80482.description:
User Summary

A box set of expansions for The Sims 2 featuring a Teen/College theme.

videogame: The Sims 2: Kitchen & Bath Interior Design Stuff
80483.name: The Sims 2: Best of Business Collection
videogamecompilation: The Sims 2: Kitchen & Bath Interior Design Stuff
80483.description:
User Summary

Box set of expansions for The Sims 2 that feature a business theme.

80484.name: APBA Golf Game
80484.description:
The game has been updated by Dr. Tom Cline and redesigned for accuracy and enjoyment! The game comes with 20 All-time great golfers along with the DC Metro Golf Course (Congressional).

The course has been painstakingly designed for the utmost accuracy and depiction. Like all of our updated games, the instructions and boards are combined in a handy spiral bound 7 1/2" x 10" booklet. The course comes in its own booklet! The course booklet is roughly the size of the Baseball and Football Master Game booklets. Also, we've printed the course holes on a coated stock that allows us to eliminate the use of the old golf markers. Now you can mark your holes with a fine tip wipe marker (included) with its own eraser! That's right no more bumping the table and accidentally moving the markers.

The current add-on courses available from APBA are Magnolia (Augusta National), Badger Links (Whistling Straits) and NY Empire State (Bethpage Black).

80485.name: The Sims 2: Fun with Pets Collection
80485.description:
User Summary

Box set of expansions for The Sims 2 that feature a pets theme.

80486.name: Under the Castle Gates
80486.description:
From the back of the book

When livestock disappears from the settlement of Banswulfburh, there are no warriors available to investigate. The crime is left to a valiant band of apprentices to solve, to some a passage to adulthood.

The task while frought with danger, could be the making of our young heroes.

To fail will result in dishonour or even death, but to succeed may bring them fame beyond measure.

80487.name: Finding Nemo
videogamefranchise: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)
videogamehonor: 2005 British Academy Game Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
80487.description:
From the back of the case:

Guide Marlin, Dory and Nemo through the ultimate underwater adventure. Meet all of the great characters from the Disney/Pixar movie, Finding Nemo, as you live all the excitement of the film's storyline. The search for Nemo is on, and it's up to you to find him. Dive in!

80488.name: Where Heroes Fear To Tread
80488.description:
Taken from the background section

The adventure is set in the campaign world of Marakush, specifically the northeastern corner of the Kingdom of Urtind. The players should begin play in the town of Militas having just completed their last adventure and are fully recouperated.

Some ten days ago a group of pilgrims were attacked as they passed by the southwestern portion of Darken Forest. They were captured and taken prisoner, and a ransom note sent to town. It is at this point the players become involved...

80489.name: The Sims 2: Apartment Life Limited Collection
80489.description:
User Summary

Box set of The Sims 2: Double Deluxe and the Apartment Life expansion. Unlike the later Sims 2 expansion collections, this includes the base game.

80490.name: Star Wars Episode III: Revenge of the Sith
80490.description:
"Star Wars: Episode III Revenge of the Sith is the official LucasArts 2005 video game based on the movie of the same name. It centers around Obi-Wan Kenobi and Anakin Skywalker as the Clone Wars come to an end."

Source: Wikipedia, "Star Wars Episode III: Revenge of the Sith (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

80491.name: SnoCross 2 Featuring Blair Morgan
80491.description:
From the back of the case:

Strap on your body armor and hang on tight. You're about to do battle atop 450 pounds of powder-crunching fury. The ice stinging your face is the least of your worries when you're sideswiping the best snowmobile racers in the world.

Join Blair Morgan, the undisputed champion of snocross, on over 30 unyielding tracks. Buy, customize and race your snowmobile of choice against a ruthless swarm of competitors. The conditions are fierce and the terrain is unrelenting. Are you up to the challenge?

80492.name: Star Wars Episode III: Revenge of the Sith (Handheld)
80492.description:
"Star Wars: Episode III Revenge of the Sith is the official LucasArts 2005 video game based on the movie of the same name. It centers around Obi-Wan Kenobi and Anakin Skywalker as the Clone Wars come to an end."

Source: Wikipedia, "Star Wars Episode III: Revenge of the Sith (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

80493.name: Williams Arcade's Greatest Hits
80493.description:
From the back of the case

Williams Arcade's Greatest Hits

The hits that once made you a regular in local arcades are now coming home! Relive the old days chasing down the dirty scum in Bubbles! Enjoy Defender once again as you navigate your vessel through alien territory! Defender II includes added villains and features not found in the original Defender! Challenge gladiators in a fight to the death in Joust! Once again, Robotron: 2004 lets you clash with a mutant force of robots to save the only remaining human family! With the coolest graphics of its time, SiniStar returns with great outerspace battle action. Bring back some great memories, and master your favorite arcade classics once again!

80495.name: The Legend of Spyro: The Eternal Night
80495.description:
From the back of the case:

On the Night of Eternal Darkness, Spyro must prevent Gaul, the Ape King, from resurrecting the Dark Master. Faced with little time, great danger and new enemies, Spyro fights his way through an epic journey, featuring the voice talents of Elijah Wood, Billy West and Gary Oldman.

80496.name: Atlantis: The Lost Empire
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edtion
80496.description:
From the back of the case

Deep... below the earth's surface dwells mystery beyond your wildest dreams.
Deeper... lies an ancient, undiscovered land.
Deeper still... the keys to unlock its secret wait deep below the earth's surface.

Driven by the legend of Atlantis, join Milo Thatch as he leads a team of experts to unlock the secrets of The Lost Empire. Journey to uncharted depths, far below the ocean surface where hidden dangers swim, lurk and spy from every nook and cranny. What you encounter next will change things forever...

The adventure awaits you.

80497.name: Tokyo Xtreme Racer: Drift 2
80497.description:
From the back of the case:

With the mysterious disappearance of the reigning champion, the tournament crown is suddenly up for grabs. Many will vie, only one can win. Do you have what it takes to race, grind and drift your way to the ultimate racing prize?

Race in the picturesque mountains of Japan - Hakone, Niko, Haruna, and Akagi, - all faithfully recreated using the most advanced laser techniques to maintain every tight twist and hazardous turn. Enter your car in sanctioned races held during the day for money - enter the races at night to defeat your bitter rivals. The championship and glory are waiting.

80498.name: Cardinal Syn
80498.description:
From the back of the case

Ask For Forgiveness.
You're About to Commit the Ultimate Syn!

A brutal battle-to-the-death. Only one warrior will survive - but not before experiencing excruciating pain and suffering.

KEY FEATURES
Torture, mutilation, rivers of blood and bestial howls - definitely not for the weak at heart.

Real-time true 360∘, 3D fighting action. You're about to face the ugliest fate possible to any living being.

Hundreds of complex precision moves and combos. Amazing razor-tight controls. Only the skilled will make the kill!

18 warriors in all, including 2 secret syns. Each with a unique, distinct look, magic, projectiles, lethal weapons and individual fighting styles.

"Living" death chambers. You may not die, but you'll probably wish you did.

80499.description:
In this Goodies 2007: Bonus Objects

You will find,

2 Cursed trunks
1 Ring
1 Ring of weakness
1 Ring of repulsion
1 Teleportation ring
1 Anti-magic ring
1 Jade mask
In gold color!
4 Elven Bows (B/Y/R/G color)!

The rules ares in Dungeon Twister site (.org).
80499.name: Dungeon Twister: Bonus Objects

80500.name: Crash Bash
80500.description:
From the back of the case

Bring it on, baby!

Crash and his friends are back in a knock-down, drag-out arena rumble. That's right. Get ready to ride, race, jump, throw and battle it out to the finish. Blow stuff up. Toss TNT. Duke it out in a jungle. It's just a good old-fashioned bandicoot brawl.

•Think fast and play fast! Frantic, head-to-head battles, heart-pumping chases, exploration and adrenaline-rushing races for points.

•All-time favorite characters - get ready to rumble. Crash, Coco, Dingodile, Tiny, Koala Kong, Dr. Neo Cortex, N. Brio and new baddie Rilla Roo.

•Adventure, Battle, and Tournament modes deliver nothin' but fun! Take it Solo, Team play or plug in the Multitap and show your friends who's really top bandicoot!

•More than 30 competitive events and tons of rides! Tanks, pogo sticks, hover ships, polar bears and more!

This isn't conventional warfare, but then again, Crash isn't a conventional bandicoot.
